El uso respectivo que dará el segundo crédito es para la compra de semillas de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder empezar a cultivar más productos para luego venderlas en el mercado de su comunidad y así obtener una ganancias para el sustento de su familia y para que tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada. 

El cambio que realiza un crédito es principalmente asegurar  la cosecha con los insumos y el manejo en general de las cosechas agrícolas, para que las personas obtengan productos de la mejora calidad y es lo que a ocurrido con Jorge que por medio de los prestamos que se les a concedido el a podido obtener mejores cosechas.

Una de las metas de el es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para una condición de vida adecuada y estudios para sus hijos para que se conviertan en profesionales en la vida y seguir cosechando las tierras fértiles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Working the land under an unforgiving sun but willing to sweat under the heat in order to give his children a better future, 47-year-old Jorge is driven by this motive to take out a new loan in order to invest in his potato farm.

Jorge has taken out loans before with other institutions but the terms were not as good as with ADICLA [Kiva Filed Partner], such as the method of repayment, the interest rate and the repayment date. These better terms are benefits that help him dream of a better future for his children. 

Jorge will use this second loan to buy seed potatoes and organic fertilizers in order to grow more crops and later sell them in his local market. This will allow him to earn the income he needs to sustain his family and give them decent living conditions.

What the loan will mean to him is basically to guarantee that he will have a good harvest with all the supplies he needs, so that his customers will have better products. This has been his experience in the past, as previous loans have allowed him to have better harvests.

One of Jorge's goals is to build houses for his children to improve their living conditions and also to help them get an education so that they can learn a profession. He would like to continue to work the fertile lands of his community.

loans.use: buy seed potatoes and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una sastrería de su comunidad.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. Ella es Gregoria de 50 años de edad y con grandes aspiraciones en superar en la vida ella tiene 3 hijos que son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella dignamente realiza en la comunidad donde ella vive es modista y costurera, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 8 años ella aprendió esa actividad gracias a que una gran mujer que tenía una confección de ropa en la comunidad, lo contrato y ella aprendió y se decidió a emprender ella también dicho negocio ya que deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso que ella dará al crédito realizado es para la remodelación de su vivienda ya que las condiciones de vida que ella tiene no son las adecuadas para habitar y es por ello que se ha decidido a realizar un préstamo para remodelar su casa así tener las condiciones de vida adecuada para ella y su familia. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es instalar un local en el centro de su comunidad para tener ventas mayores son las que ahora realiza y dar estudios a sus hijos para que ellos sean profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Life gave Gregoria an opportunity to work as for a tailor in her community. It was all she had hoped for: not just an open door, but what was behind that door. What she found defined what she wanted to be. Gregoria is 50 years old and has big aspirations to succeed in life. She has 3 children who are excellent students in the community school.

Gregoria makes a dignified living as a dressmaker and seamstress in her community, which she has been doing for 8 years. She learned the trade from a wonderful woman who had a clothing production business in the community. She hired her and learned from her, and then decided to start her own such business as it would give her profits to improve her family’s quality of life. 

She will use the loan to remodel her home, as the current conditions are not suitable to live in. This is why she decided to request a loan to remodel her home and thus have appropriate conditions for her and her family. One of her dreams is to open a shop in her community center to have higher sales and to give her children an education so that they become working professionals in different fields in their community.

loans.use: to remodel her home.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with two children, who both attend school. She also takes care of her sister and brother. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. She gets additional income from farming.

She sells second-hand shoes at the market to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 11 years, and she works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of second-hand shoes and clothes. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to build rental houses and plot of land for farming. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bales of used shoes and clothes

loans.name: Al Karrar Group

texts.en:
Mayada is the featured borrower for the Al Karrar Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses, and living at the same time.

Mayada is a 40-year-old married mother of six children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started four years ago preparing and selling chocolate souvenirs to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her family.

Mayada is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to develop her business.  Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy decoration materials which will help her prepare special chocolate souvenirs for the Christmas season.

Mayada is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Sabah is the lady sitting in the middle, and Fatima is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy decoration materials to prepare special chocolate souvenirs for the Christmas season

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming, and has been in this business for a few months. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed, chicks, and charcoal. She generates additional income from selling charcoal and rental houses. She works from home seven days a week, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation, poultry diseases, and thieves. She is aspiring of building more rental rooms. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed,vaccines, and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is aged 39, and a mother of three children. She has managed ice cream and ice vending in their village for almost three years, and earns a net income of PHP 4,500 weekly. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase additional ice cream containers for her business. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase additional ice cream containers for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 51-year-old married woman, and a mother of nine grown-up children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now.

Alma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. This loan will help Alma and her husband in augmenting their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Alma hopes of making their business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia, aged 48, is a responsible mother and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC. She is an old member; she has been receiving loans according to the needs of her family.

She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to manage all the household expenses with poor earnings. In fact, her husband owns a cooking oil shop and sells kinds of cooking oil. He wants to buy a large quantity of cooking oil to sell for the growth of his business, and to overcome the poverty. 

Therefore, Fozia has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy more cooking oil. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 65 years old and widowed with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc..

She has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Yolanda is 54 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Yolanda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 43 years old and has four children. All of her children are in school.

Julieta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Julieta has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edin Elferes

texts.es:
Edin tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rustico junto a sus padres, ubicada en el Caserío Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Edin se dedica a la actividad que realiza es la de prestar servicio de transporte urbano. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en compra de llatas, batería y sistema eléctrico. Esta inversión le permitirá mejores condiciones de vida. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edin is 26 years old. He lives with his parents in a rustic home located in the Playa Azul neighborhood, a rural zone in the Pucará district. Residents make a living through agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the Jaén province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the mountainous northern region of Peru.

Edin works for a company for  transporting passengers in urban locations. He will use this loan to buy tires, a battery and an electrical system for his car. With this investment, his living conditions will improve, as he will make more profits and his income will increase, resulting in a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy tires, a battery and an electrical system for his car.

loans.name: Joenel

texts.en:
Joenel is a tricycle driver from Ormoc City, Leyte. He is 37 years old, married, and has two children. He has been in the business for more than 10 years now.

Joenel is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like a wheel tire, nuts and bolts, chains and others, and to pay for the repair of the tricycle. This means that Joenel will be able to transport more passengers, thus augmenting his income.

In the future, Joenel hopes to make his business successful and productive. Moreover, he wants to save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle, like a wheel tire, nuts and bolts, chains and others, and to pay for the repair of the tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer as she has a butcher shop and doesn't have a place to store the meat.

loans.name: Durbelly

texts.es:
Durbelly es una madre cabeza de familia con ingresos muy modestos, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 9 años que depende en su totalidad de ella, ha logrado generar el sustento con la ayuda de un su negocio de papelería y venta de bolis de diferentes sabores, tal y como se puede ver en la foto.
Su preocupación es poder generar los suficientes recursos para cubrir todas las necesidades, desde pagar la matrícula de sus hijos, la alimentación, darles cualquier moneda para que compren algo en el descanso y múltiples preocupaciones de madre.
En base a esta preocupación Durbelly quiere solicitar un crédito con la idea de comprar surtido de útiles escolares.
Tu ayuda puede hacer que Durbelly tenga la oportunidad de generar los ingresos suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar
texts.en:
Durbelly is a mother and the head of a family with a very modest income. She has two children, aged 20 and 9, who completely depend on her. She has managed to generate enough income to support her family with the help of her business, selling stationery and different pens, as you can see in the photo.

She is concerned about being able to generate enough income to meet all her family’s needs, from paying for her children’s education to feeding them, giving them money for them to buy things to play with, and all the other things mothers worry about.

Based on this, Durbelly wants to request a loan with the idea of buying school supplies for her business’ inventory.

Your help can make it so Durbelly has the opportunity to generate enough income to cover all her household expenses.

loans.use: to invest in school supplies for her stationery shop

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe Sánchez, de 64 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos y niguno vive con ella. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Es comerciante vende yuca frita y salcochada, pastelitos, nuégados, enchiladas y refrescos todos los días de 3:00 pm a 5:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y pagar mano de obra para arreglar el techo y el piso de su cocina, en las pasadas lluvias le dio muchos problemas por la filtración de agua. Espera tener fuerzas para seguir trabajando y sacar a delante a su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Sanchez is 64 years old, widowed, and has 4 children none of whom live with her. She did not have the opportunity to study. She is a businesswoman who sells fried and boiled yucca, pastelitos [Salvadorean empanadas], nuégados [syrup-coated fried dumplings], enchiladas, and soft drinks every day from 3 PM to 5 PM. 

She is requesting the loan to buy materials and pay for labor to fix the roof and floor of her kitchen. In the recent downpours, she has had a lot of problems due to water leaks. She hopes to have the strength to keep working and help her youngest child get ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay labor to fix the roof and floor of her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a machine to cut wood

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: KOMLAN fait l’élevage des poules depuis 2007 dans une petite ferme de « Noépé » où il s’approvisionne une fois par mois ,mais il habite à Lomé au quartier d’Adidogomé ;c’est un homme âgé de 41 ans, célibataire sans enfant qui aime se battre pour assurer,dit-il, son lendemain et celui de sa future petite famille .Pour, mieux répondre aux énormes demandes de sa clientèle, KOMLAN désire un prêt pour faire face à ces éventualités afin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Komlan has been raising chickens since 2007 in a small farm near Noepe where he resupplies once a month, but he lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lome.

This is a 41-year-old single man with no children who likes to fight for his livelihood and that of his future small family. To better meet his customers' huge demands, Komlan is seeking a loan to deal with contingencies and increase his profit margin.

loans.use: buy nine cartons of chicks

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena de 45 años de edad que tiene una grande aspiración de poder superarse en la vida, ella toma todos los obstáculos de la viva como un reto para poder llegar al éxito, ella tiene 6 hijos los cueles se han convertido el motivo de poder superarse y buscar  la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico. Todos los hijos de ella son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad. 
	
La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de  hilos, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 7 años, ella se decidió a realizar dicha actividad porque por su comunidad no hay personas que realizan la venta de hilos y a ella le genera muy buena ganancia y ingresos económicos par el sostenimiento de su familia y en mejor las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito es para la compra de materia prima de hilos para surtir su mercadería para así poner a disposición de las personas que requieren de estos productos. Uno de las aspiraciones de Magdalena es ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 45, aspires to improve herself in life.  She takes all the obstacles in life as a challenge to be able to achieve success.  She has six children, who have become her motivation for self-improvement and wanting to have an income.  All the children are excellent students in school, which is near their community.

Magdalena's job is selling thread, work she has done for seven years.  She decided on this job because there was nobody selling thread in her community.  It generates very good profits and an income for her to support her family and improve their living conditions.

She's going to use the loan to buy thread to stock her merchandise so she has it on hand for people who need the product.

One of Magdalena's goals is to see her children become professionals and to build houses for them so they have acceptable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David tiene 74 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre hogareño que disfruta de apoyar a su grupo familiar y de mejorar cada día las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar. David cuenta con un área de su vivienda que aún no ha construido ya que en ella desea construir un corredor para tener un lugar agradable para descansar y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, hierro, pines y polines para construir un corredor en su vivienda.
texts.en:
David is 74 years old and lives in his own home with his common-law wife and their family. He is a man who loves his home and enjoys supporting his family and bettering their living conditions.

David would like to complete his house by building a covered outdoor area where the family can relax and so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI [Kiva Field Partner] to invest in galvanized metal sheets, iron, fasteners and poles that he will use to build this covered area.

loans.use: buy galvanized metal sheets, iron, fasteners and poles that he will use to build a covered outdoor living space.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beans, rice, sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a pub where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of drinks. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will excel in business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a married man. He has two children with ages ranging from two to six years old. He describes himself to be focused. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy town and his primary customers are commuters. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, which affects his business. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stock of motorcycle spare parts to sell. His business goal is to own a fleet of motorcycles within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy stock of motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 45-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ruth has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Ruth described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Ruth’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bikonde

texts.en:
Bikonde runs a coffee cooperative in Rwanda's Eastern Province. Bikonde has been running his cooperative since 2009. Bikonde's business has been quite successful since inception, supplying the highest quality coffee to many international coffee exporters in Rwanda.  

Although Bikonde's business has been profitable for the past several seasons, he needs a loan to purchase a new machine to replace the old one, which is outdated and inefficient. This will increase his capacity and enable him to create 40 additional jobs. 

Bikonde is a trustworthy business owner committed to his community. AEC is pleased to support his expansion. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase a coffee washing machine.

loans.name: Cocpab

texts.en:
COCPAB is a group of farmers from different areas in the community of Passe Bois d’Ormes in Aquin, who formed in 1978 with the aim of improving living conditions of farmers while allowing them to better cultivate their land. Wilnor, as coordinator, noted many problems in agriculture such as the dependence on rain. He then requested an irrigation pumping system with five pumps from a previous organization. To ensure that farmers are able to increase their profit in cultivating market products, the leader of COCPAB organized training in 2012 for needy members to invest more in market products and techniques to cultivate those products.Their irrigation channel, along with their profitability and the great demand for market gardening in the local market, are strengths that encourage them to invest more in agriculture. 

In the picture, Celhomme joined his hands. He is the vice- president(on the right). Abner  who wears the glasses is the first advisor. Wilnor is next to him in the back.Clausette is the second secretary, she wears a hat.Jean Baptiste, as second advisor, is next to her. Rodelene, as treasurer is the woman in the back row. Etienne, as Delegate is also in the back with the blue shirt. Franslene is in front, as third advisor and Jean Pierre, the general secretary in behind her.Today, this committee board is seeking a soft loan to increase their agricultural supplies such as seeds and fuel for their watering pumps.Their profit will grow as end result.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, gas for the watering pump and the operation costs for the field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, underwear, etc., to keep on helping with the household budget

loans.name: Prosy

texts.en:
Prosy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of whom are attending school. She is also looking after three of her grandchildren.
She has been operating a restaurant on a retail basis for the last 10 years, working six days a week. She does some tailoring as well for additional income.

She has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings 600,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy cooking oil, bunches of green bananas, rice, flour, beans and a bag of charcoal. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to build residential house . She joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital for the business she was already doing and for the nearness of the services.

She resides in a rented house with access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beans, flour, rice and a bag of charcoal

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  Vergie works very hard to provide for them.

Vergie runs a buy and sell of fish business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Vergie has been in this business for seven years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 49 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Belinda works very hard to provide for them.

Belinda runs a buy and sell of dried fish in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business.

Belinda has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bulus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bulus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Bulus, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming in her farm

loans.name: John And Lisa

texts.en:
More than 20 years ago, back when people with beards and bowl cuts were building computers in garages, John and Lisa were fiddling with computers. They took courses on how to use computers before Apple introduced their graphic interface, so their expertise is hard to question. They know how computers work. They custom built two solid-state desktop PCs that outperform the competition. They also gained a deep knowledge on how to repair computers and electronics, which led them to found their business, Bunny SD Computer Solutions. 

The challenge for John and Lisa has always been getting the word out. They know they need to set their prices lower than their competitors in order to get a foot in the door, but that’s not a problem since they say competitors charge such exorbitant fees for their services. Lisa says their competitors will often charge for four hours of labor when she can get the job done in 20 minutes.

They will use their Kiva loan to cover costs associated with advertising, tools crucial for computer repair, a high quality digital camera, and a special light for photography. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, John and Lisa will be the next set of techie gurus in San Diego.

loans.use: to cover costs associated with advertising, tools crucial for computer repair, a high quality digital camera, and a special light for photography.

loans.name: Binapani Group

texts.en:
This group is located in Muniguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The group consists of five women members from the below-poverty-line category, and Gouri is one of them. The lady seated in the middle with a raised hand in the photo is Gouri. She is 30 years old. She is the leader of this SHG (self-help group). She lives with her husband and only daughter, aged about three years.

Gouri is collecting leaf plates, stitching them by hand, and selling them in the nearby market. Gouri manages the in-house activities as well as the business smartly. From these businesses, she earns a monthly income of 7,500 INR.

According to Gouri, in the context of present market situation, this income is hand-to-mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of the future development. Although there is potential market for her business, finance was a hindrance for her. After intervention of the Mahashakti Foundation in her village, she saw a ray of hope and motivated other women members to borrow from Mahashakti Foundation by forming this group. It will be the fourth-cycle loan.

From the present loan, she has planned to purchase more leaves for stitching as well as leaf plates from others to expand the existing business. She hopes this will help her to generate more income to materialize her dream of giving better education to her children and constructing a house for her family.

The other four members of the group are also doing the same business.

loans.use: to purchase leaves for stitching.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana left her native country, the Dominican Republic, about 7 years ago with a dream in mind: to be her own boss. Growing up she learned how to do hair, playing with her cousins, neighbors and friends. She opened Belkis Beauty Salon in New Brunswick, NJ shortly after working for another local beauty salon in New Brunswick. Determined to achieve her goal to prosper in a foreign country and armed with her skills and talent as a hairdresser she serves the community with pleasure. 

The $7700 that was provided for her business are going to allow her to recuperate funds that were stolen from her store. Those funds were reserved to buy the beauty products that she uses on a daily basis for clients. This will allow her to enhance her service for frequent and new clients. 

She hopes that this purchase will keep her clientele happy and satisfied-which will ultimately bring more clients.

loans.use: To pay for inventory after someone broke in and stole her working capital.

loans.name: Joecel

texts.en:
Joecel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation in her farming rice business.

Joecel has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from cutting rice stalks.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Joecel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation in her farming rice business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 53 years old and married with six children, one whom is in school. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a buy and sell business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fuel to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fuel to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 53 years old and married with four children. She earns a living in the Philippines. 

Cynthia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of medicine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Cynthia has been selling natural medicines for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of medicine

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 46 years old, married, has two children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Felomina has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and single.

Marilyn runs a buy and sell rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 16 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old, and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell ready to wear products in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like shirts, shorts, slippers, etc.

Helen has been in this business for 28 years.

She would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like shirts, shorts, slippers, etc

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 48 years old and a widow with five children, four of whom are in school. Melinda works very hard to provide for them.

Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like sugar, rice, spices, etc.

Melinda has been in this business for 17 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like sugar, rice, spices, etc

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.es:
Orfilia es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como arepas, tamales y comidas regionales.
Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y su hijo de 3 años quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.
Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.
Orfilia solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de mesas, sillas y una carpa para atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera.
Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir su sueño de otorgar una buena educación a su hijo
Con tu ayuda Orfilia Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Orfilia is a very enterprising and tenacious woman with big dreams that she has been cultivating and trying to make reality.

She has a small business preparing and selling foods like "arepas" [filled corn-dough flatbread], "tamales" [filled corn dough steamed in leaves], and regional dishes. With this business, she tries every day to get ahead and improve the living conditions of her family, made up of her husband and her three-year-old son, who are the driving force in her life and her motivation for pressing on everyday.

Her biggest difficulty is the competition in the area, but with her great work ethic, she is capable of sustaining herself and making progress.

Orfilia is requesting a loan to purchase tables, chairs, and a canopy to better serve her customers. With this help, she will be able to fulfill her dream of granting her son a good education.

With your help, Orfilia will be able to pay for her son's education, which is one of her biggest dreams!

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a canopy

loans.name: Ziyodamo

texts.ru: Зиёдамо выражает свою благодарность кредиторам Kiva, за помощь и поддержку с их стороны. Первый кредит стал для нее настоящей помощью. Она надеется, с таким же успехом ее профинансируют во второй раз. На этот раз она просит кредит для купли дров и муки. С увеличением сырых продуктов увеличиться производства лепешек, соответственно у нее будет больше дохода и у семьи будет больше экономических возможностей. Она заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en: Ziyodamo expresses her gratitude to the Kiva lenders who helped her and supported her.  Her first loan was really helpful to her, and she is now hoping to obtain financing a second time with the same level of success.  This time, she is taking a loan to buy firewood and flour.  By buying more of these goods, Ziyodamo will be able to increase her production of bread, which will in turn increase her income and create new economic opportunities for her family.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy firewood and flour.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salomé es una bella mujer de 20 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 6 años, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su actual casa. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de elementos de trabajo como secadores, planchas y surtido de productos capilares.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes ya que será determinante porque dejo su ciudad natal para aventurarse en Medellin buscando un mejor futuro. 

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Salome!
texts.en:
Salomé is a beautiful 20-year-old woman, and the mother of a 6-year-old son. She was raised to have very good habits.  Since high school she developed a great passion and taste for everything related to beauty.  She started out taking courses and training classes, until the day she ventured out and decided to go in search of her own customers, setting up a beauty salon in her home.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies such as hair dryers, straightening irons, and hair products.  The loan will be very important for her business and will result in her being able to provide her business with all the necessary supplies to operate and offer the services her customers request.

Her dream is for her business to progress with the help of Interactuar, and to have many customers.  She is determined since she left her home town in order to venture out into the city looking for a better future.  Please consider lending to Salomé.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as hair dryers, straightening irons, and hair products.

loans.name: Rita Nelvia

texts.es: Rita es una mujer de 51 años de edad que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio de venta de productos básicos como: jabón, champú, detergente, arroz, azúcar, café, etc. Además aprovecha frutas y verduras obteniendo mejores ingresos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una mayor de edad que le apoya económicamente y una hija de 8 años de edad. Rita sabe que en su tienda son muchos los productos que puede vender con los cuales no cuenta por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sachet de champú, leche, pan francés, golosinas, especies, huevos, queso, etc. Para tener mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.
texts.en: Rita is a 51 year old woman who strives to support her household through her business selling basic products such as soap, shampoo, detergent, rice, sugar, coffee, etc. In addition she takes advantage of fruits and vegetables, obtaining more income. She lives in her own home with her 2 children: one adult child supports her economically and another daughter 8 years old. Rita knows that in her store there are many products that can sell but she doesn't have any so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in shampoo, milk, french bread, candy, spices, eggs. cheese, etc. in order to have a great variety of products in her business.

loans.use: to invest in shampoo, milk, french bread, candy, spices, eggs. cheese, etc.

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Салим  живет в кишлаке Хабутак. Он женат и имеет 4х детей.  Он занимается животноводством и земледелием. Он очень трудолюбивый и честный человек. Старается для благополучия своей семьи.  Основным доходом его семьи является купля продажа скота. Этим он зарабатывает на жизнь. Он  хочет купит скот, но из за нехватки собственных средств обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие МДО Арванд.
texts.en: Salim lives in a village called Khabutak.  He is married and the father of four children.  He works in animal husbandry and agriculture, and is a very hardworking and honest man.  He works hard for the welfare of his family.  Their main source of income comes from buying and selling cattle, which is how Salim makes a living.  Salim now wants to buy additional cattle, but because he doesn't have enough money, he has turned to MDO Arvand for a loan.  He thanks them in advance for their support and trust.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine, pay medical consultation bills and undergoing medical examinations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bean, corn and jicama seed, and in addition manure.

loans.name: Mavzunakhon

texts.ru: Мавзунахон молодая швея в возрасте 20 лет, проживающая в районе Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Она недавно вышла замуж, но сейчас живет у матери, так как муж находится за пределами страны на заработках. Мавзунахон не сидит дома, она тоже работает. Вот уже три года как она работает в ателье и предоставляет услуги швеи. Она занимается шитьем женской национальной одежды и у нее достаточно клиентов. Мавзунахон хочет расширить сферу своих услуг. Она за счет кредита собирается купить компьютерную швейную машинку, чтобы помимо шитья, еще и делать вышивку на платьях. Таким образом она расширит свой швейный бизнес и увеличит его доходность.
texts.en: Mavzunakhon is a 20-year-old seamstress who lives in the B. Gafurov district of the city of Khujand. Although she recently got married, she now lives with her mother, as her husband has left the country to make a living abroad.  Mavzunakhon doesn't stay at home, she works as a seamstress in a shop, and she has been involved in this activity for the past three years already.  She sews traditional women's clothes and she has a good number of customers.  She now wants to expand the scope of her services.  She plans to use her loan to buy an electronic sewing machine, in order to do some embroidery in addition to sewing.  This will allow her to expand her sewing business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine for embroidery.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Las Estrellitas” y está conformada por 06 socios emprendedores y solidarios. Raquel de 38 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. El deseo de Raquel es acondicionar su taller de costura. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y cierres. El grupo “Las Estrellitas” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Raquel es la segunda del lado derecho y viste casaca color morado claro.
texts.en:
This is the group “Las Estrellitas” [The Little Stars] and it is made up of six entrepreneurial and united members. Raquel is 38 years old and separated, with 2 dependent children. She makes clothing for a living. With great effort she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her children. Raquel's wish is to set up her sewing workshop. It is for this reason that she asked for a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and fasteners. 

The group "Las Estrellitas" is thankful to those people who make this loan possible. Raquel is the second from the right in the photo wearing a light purple sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and fasteners/zippers

loans.name: Francis Antonio

texts.es: Francis es un hombre de 28 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Él se esfuerza por darle lo mejor que está en sus manos a su familia, por lo que pone todo su empeño en su trabajo como jornalero, el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Francis desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda y encementar el piso de su vivienda, a que actualmente es de tierra lo que está causando enfermedades respiratorias a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos, cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francis is a 28-year-old man who lives together with his significant other and his 2-year-old son. He works hard to provide as best as he can for his family, and as such he is dedicated to his work as a day laborer. This has allowed him to get his family ahead. 

Francis wants to change the roof and cement the floor of his home, since it is currently made of dirt which is causing respiratory illnesses in his family. For this reason he is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: galvanized sheet metal, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to cement the ground and change the roof of his home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, who is 31 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two single children who live under her support. To make a living and support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average.

As a supplementary earning, she has come up with a new business idea. She wants to buy hard stone and make it into mortars for sale. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy hard stone and make it into mortars for sale.

She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standard. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy hard stone and make it into mortars for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and materials such as pliers, grease, electrodes, antennas, valves, etc. and in this continue supporting his household.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 43 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de mango y naranja, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en un mercado del municipio de Sonson, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 2 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de José Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
José, 43, is a modest and hardworking farmworker who learned all the farm tasks at a young age thanks to his father's lessons.  Currently he has mango and orange crops, which he harvests and sells in a market of the town where he lives.  This gives him the income he needs to feed his family on a daily basis and pay for his wife and children's basic needs.

José's motivated to request a loan to invest in buying agricultural inputs wholesale (soil amendments, pesticide, fertilizer).  That will allow him to keep on taking care of his crops and improve his productivity in the next harvest, which will improve the income he earns on each sale.

He said his biggest dream is to keep on striving to have financial stability and give his family better living conditions and well-being.

José will be able to maintain his crop and get ahead with your help!

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs wholesale (soil amendments, pesticide, fertilizer)

loans.name: Yalam Tagni Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Luisa, Delia y Ursula) de la etnia miskita.en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que lucha dia a dia por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de comercialización de mariscos, venta de ropa usada; se organizaron hace aproximadamente tres años para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. El nombre del Grupo Solidario es en lengua mískita que significa Flor del árbol Cedro Real, cuya madera es muy preciada en todas partes.  

Luisa: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, con cualidades de líder, es casada, tiene  cinco hijos, 4 son mayores de edad e independientes y un adolescente que estudia su secundaria en una escuela en Bilwi. Desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que compra en la comunidad miskita cercana a Bilwi que se llama Lamlaya (agua mansa), de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para poder comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una tienda donde venda ropa, especialmente ropa usada que es lo que más demanda la población actualmente.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three Miskito women (Luisa, Delia, and Ursula) in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are enterprising women who fight every day to grow their small businesses selling seafood and used clothing. The organized approximately 3 years ago in order to access guaranteed loans from Pana Pana. The name of the group is in the Miskito language and it means Flower of the Royal Cedar, whose wood is very valued in all parts.

Luisa is the coordinator of the group. She is a friendly woman, with qualities of a leader. She is married, has 5 children, 4 are grown and independent and one adolescent studies in the high school in Bilwi. For 7 years she has been selling fish and seafood that she buys in the Miskito community near Bilwi that is called Lamlaya, and in this way she generates her own income and contributes to the household expenses and her child's education.

She is seeking a loan to be able to buy more seafood and fish to sell and increase her income and serve more people who demand this product that constitutes one of the basic foods in Bilwi.

She dreams of having enough capital to establish a store where she sells clothing, especially used clothing which is what is in most demand by the population there today.

loans.use: to buy seafood and fish.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Isidro, es un grupo unido, formado en la ciudad de San Ignacio, formado con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad.
La Sra. Magdalena integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la lavandería, es una mujer muy trabajadora que sueña con poder crecer y salir adelante.  Comenta que se dedica a la lavandería, lava ropas de sus clientes, y por medio de este oficio tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y otros seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de jabones, suavizantes, desodorante de prendas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en: This group is called San Isidro. It is a united group formed in the city of San Ignacio by a union of various neighbours and friends in that city. Mrs. Magdalena is a member of this group. She makes a living in laundry. She is a very hard-working woman who dreams of being able to grow and succeed. She says that she works at a laundry, washing the clothes of its customers, and through this profession has the means to help her family and other loved ones. She asks for this loan to buy soaps, softener, garment deodorant, etc., so in this way she can continue with her work as she has done. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has received which will allow continued growth.

loans.use: Buy soaps, softener, garment deodorant, etc.

loans.name: Flor Creciente Group

texts.es:
Dionicia es una mujer  de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones de 24 y 22 años y una hija mujer de 19 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de plantillas para zapatos.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un área comercial caracterizada por su tradicional feria los días jueves y domingo, dónde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 2-12 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Dionicia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español para el comercio (sentada a la izquierda, usa gorra negra). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos; los mayores son independientes y trabajan, la hija menor estudia en un instituto. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas a domicilio. Sus ganas y deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, elaboración de empanadas, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras y venta de helado, para solicitar un préstamos y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración de plantillas para calzado, y las elabora de diferentes materiales como; cuero, poliuretano, neopreno y porón. El proceso de elaboración de estas plantillas comenzó con una exploración minuciosa del patrón del pie, Lo siguiente fue obtener las huellas plantares con el mero apoyo estático del pie sobre un cartón, para reproducirlas y venderlas. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en comercios de calzados, y en la feria. “mis plantillas están pensadas para dar el máximo de comodidad y también efectividad contra exceso de sudor en los pies…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller propio en su domicilio. Ella desea realizar la compra de materiales para realizar plantillas por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Dionicia solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la realización de plantillas para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 44, is married and has two sons, 24 and 22, and a daughter, 19.  Her business is making insoles for shoes.  She's a patient, supportive, strong, responsible, and hardworking woman as well as a good listener and a good mother.

She works in the 16 de Julio commercial area, known for its traditional street market on Thursdays and Sundays, where you can buy anything from needles for sewing to a tractor for plowing.  The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that ranges from 2 to 12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Dionicia is dark and wears her long black hair in a braid.  (She's seated at the left, wearing a black cap.)  Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for business.  She lives with her husband, a construction worker, and with her children; the older ones are independent and work, and the youngest daughter attends school.  They live in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, and gas in the home.

Her attitude and desire to improve herself led her to convene a group of people to request a loan and expand their businesses, which include coca leaf sales, quinoa juice sales, empanada production, perfume sales, beverage sales, pollera [traditional skirt] sales, and ice cream sales.

Her business is producing insoles, which she makes in different materials including leather, polyurethane, neoprene, and poron urethane.  The process for making these insoles starts with a thorough exploration of the pattern of the foot.  Next is getting the print of the footpad with only the help of the still foot on a piece of cardboard, to reproduce and sell the insoles.

She makes sales as a street vendor, in shoe stores, and in the market.  "My insoles are planned to provide maximum comfort as well as effectiveness against excess sweating," she said.  Her dream is to have her own shop in her home.

For those reasons Dionicia is requesting a loan to buy materials to make insoles wholesale so she can keep on working.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 12 years she has been working in this field.

loans.use: to buy materials to make insoles so she can keep on working

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 27 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 3 años y trabaja como secretaria en una oficina de administración de transporte. 
Ella es Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un área caracterizada por la aglomeración de transporte público interdepartamental con destino a pueblos al norte del departamento. De clima frío y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 8-16 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Silvia es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja en la mina y vuelve una vez al mes a su hogar, y con su hijo que se encuentra a su cuidado, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de superación y su pasión por la cocina la llevaron a estudiar gastronomía en un instituto muy conocido del lugar, actualmente cursa el segundo año y le queda un año para terminar, las materias que estudia actualmente son; Organización y operación de cocinas profesionales Higiene y manipulación adecuada de alimentos. Elaboración de salsas básicas y guarniciones.
Cortes de carne para aves, res, pescado y aplicaciones. Garnish y bocaditos.
Refrigeración y conservación de alimentos. Costos en alimentos y bebidas, y otras. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de comida gourmet, y desea realizar el pago de las cuotas de su carrera de gastronomía profesional, para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene estudiando esta carrera.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera de gastronomía profesional y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Silvia, 27, is married and has a son, 3.  She's an intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, supportive, strong, responsible, and hardworking woman, and she's a good listener and a good mother.

She works as a secretary in an office of transportation administration.  She works in the Villa Fátima area, known for a concentration of inter-department public transportation to towns to the north.  The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies from 8 to 16 degrees centigrade during the day.

Silvia's dark-skinned and has long brown hair.  Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for business.  She lives with her husband, a miner who comes home once a month, and her dependent son in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, and sewage.

Her desire for self-improvement and her passion for cooking led her to study in a very well-known culinary institute in the area.  Currently she's in her second year, with one more to finish.  The subjects she's studying now include professional kitchen organization and management, hygiene and food handling, basic sauces and trimmings, garnishes and snacks, refrigeration and preservation of food, food and beverage costs, and cuts of poultry, beef, and fish.  Her dream is to open a gourmet restaurant.

Silvia wants to pay the fees for her professional program so she can continue with her culinary studies.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been studying in this program.  That's why she's requesting a loan to pay her fees and finish her studies.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her professional cooking program and to finish her studies

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en: ABISHYIZEHAMWE is a group led by Florance, who is 35 years old. The group name means “Altogether” in English. She has been a group leader for two years. She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Concessa is a group leader; aged 52. She is married with one child who is 12 years old. The group is called ABISUNGANYE, which means “support each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to make their future better. 

She sells local drinks and has been in business for 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to make more local drinks to resell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to make more local drinks to resell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza Pedro de 60 años de edad, el tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 4 ya trabajan para ayudar a la economía de la familia y los 3 últimos  son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad.

La actividad que le realiza es la compra, venta y producción de maíz,  el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de maíz y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el y para el bienestar de su familia, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad.

El uso respectivo que dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de semillas de maíz y abono químico e orgánico par que sus producciones de este año sean las mejores que años anteriores. Una de las metas de el es incrementar su producción de maíz y mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de ello y seguir brindando educación a sus hijos para que sean mejores profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The land is blessed by the hands that enjoy working and taking good care of it. It is commendable that men dedicate years of life and their entire lives to this work. Without the labor of the farmers, the soil would not bear the fruits that sustain each generation. This is Pedro's work.

Pedro is 60 years old and he has seven children, four of whom already work to support the household economy. The three younger ones are excellent students at the local school.

He buys, sells, and grows corn. He chose this activity because he has the soil and climate suitable for corn crops. It generates very good income for him  and for his family's well-being.

Pedro also works as day laborer in his community, always with a view to helping the neighbors.

He will use the loan to buy corn seeds as well as chemical and organic fertilizers, so that this year his crops will turn out better than in previous years. 

One of his goals is to increase the production and improve his crop management, and also to continue supporting his children in their studies so that they get to be better professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds as well as chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Eusebio Manuel

texts.es:
Eusebio, con 25 años de edad, es un hombre casado y padre de 8 hijos. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de café, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del café en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Eusebio solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.

Eusebio sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
Eusebio, 25 years old, is a married man and the father to eight children. He was born and raised in the countryside, where he learned farming work at his father's side. Thanks to this, he now has a coffee crop, whose harvest is sold. In this way he obtains the resources to put food on his family's table.

The borrower is a vigorous man, a fighter. He is dedicated to his family and his work, and this motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead; day in and day out he fights to overcome the obstacles he is presented with. He has borne difficult economic situations due to the low market price of coffee, which affects the price of his product. 

Eusebio is requesting this loan with the Corporación Interactuar so he can invest it in buying agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers, pesticides), with the goal of continuing his business and preparing his crops for the harvest of a very high-quality product.

Eusebio's dream is to improve his crops, planting more in order to obtain from them a good monthly profit.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 5 años, y su negocio por la mañana es un kiosco de golosinas frente a una escuela y por las noches vende comida rápida.
Ella es buena madre, sensible, sincera, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural, donde los campesinos tienen sus casas y llevan toda su producción agrícola hasta ese lugar para ser distribuida y comercializada en la ciudad. De clima templado durante todo el año.
Carmen es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español para el comercio (fila de atrás, la segunda de la derecha, usa blusa marrón). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que es agricultor y sus hijos que aún no ingresan a la escuela porque son pequeños. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, confección de tejidos, venta de pescado y servicio de construcción, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Ella cuenta con 2 actividades económicas, por las mañanas y tardes se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un kiosco fijo ubicado frente a un colegio conocido, vende; chocolates, galletas, dulces, chicles, refrescos, etc. Por las noches se ocupa de vender salchipapas (salchicha con papas fritas) en un carrito de dos ruedas equipado con una cocinilla y una garrafa de gas, de forma ambulante. “con mis dos trabajos aporto a mi hogar y quiero que mis hijos estudien para que les vaya mejor…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande para darle lo necesario a su familia como una casa y estudios. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la refacción de su carrito salchipapero, la compra de bancos para sentarse y aumentar su stock de golosinas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su herramienta de trabajo, la compra de bancos para sentarse y aumentar el stock de golosinas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 30 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children ages 5 and 2. Her business in the mornings is a candy stand in front of a school and in the evenings she sells fast food. She is a good mother, sensible, honest, sincere, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in a rural area called Sacaba, where the farmers have their houses and they bring all their crops to this area to distribute and sell in the city. The area has a temperate climate all year round.

Carmen has a dark complexion, long dark hair, and is short. Her first language is Quechua and her second language is Spanish, which she uses for business. She is in the photo in the back row, second from right in the brown blouse. She works with her husband who is a farmer and her children are not yet in school because they are still young. They live in a rented home with well water and electricity. Her desires to be successful brought her to form a bank with people who have businesses such as selling clothing, selling fruit, selling tomatoes, selling empanadas, selling cosmetics, making woven goods, selling fish, construction service. They seek a loan to be able to accomplish their goals.

She has 2 businesses. In the mornings and afternoons she sells candy from a permanent kiosk located in front of a well-known high school. She sells chocolate, cookies, candy, gum, refreshments, etc. In the evenings she sells hotdogs and french fries from a two-wheeled cart equipped with a minikitchen and gas cylinder, and the cart is movable. She comments "with my two jobs I support my home and I want my children to study so their lives are better..."

Her dream is to have a large business to provide what her family needs like a house and schooling. She wishes to make an investment in her business by repairing her hot dog cart, buying benches to sit, and increasing her stock of candy.

This is the first sequence of loan with the institution in 2 years that she has had this business. For these reasons Carmen seeks a loan to repair her hot dog cart, buy benches to sit, and increase her stock of candy for his business.

loans.use: to replace her work tool, buy benches to sit, and increase the stock of candy in the business.

loans.name: Dionaliza

texts.en:
Dionaliza is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years, and it is the source of their income.

Dionaliza needs a loan for the expansion of their fishing business. She is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. This will help Dionaliza and her husband to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Dionaliza hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Mathew, Aaron and Sadik.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Maryamu  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Vailet

texts.en: Vailet, 30 years old, lives in Mundri, South Sudan. A loan of 300 SSP helps her pay for new products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.es:
Eliezer tiene 25 años, nació en la provincia Andrés Ibáñez del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia, vive con sus padres quienes se dedican a la enseñanza, por lo que Eliezer también decidió trabajar como profesor de computación en un colegio de la ciudad, los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar. 

Eliezer nos comenta que desde el colegio siempre le gustaron las materias de matemáticas y química, por esta razón decidió estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería de Gas y Petróleo en la universidad, ya que tiene la certeza de que la Industria Petrolera tiene un gran futuro en nuestro país. 

Eliezer manifiesta que su principal motivación es poder culminar sus estudios para tratar de insertarse laboralmente en una empresa del sector petrolero que le permita generar mayores ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  

Eliezer se siente muy agradecido con aquellas personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le brindan la oportunidad de alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Eliezer is 25 years old and was born in the province of Andrés Ibáñez, department of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He lives with his parents, they make a living teaching. This is why Eliezer decided to work as a computer teacher in a city school. The money he makes is used to help with household expenses.

Eliezer tells us that he likes math and chemistry since grade school. For this reason he decided to study a career in Petroleum and Gas Engineering at the university.  He is certain that the petroleum industry has a great future in the country.

Eliezer states that his main motivation is to complete his studies to be able to try to get employment in a company of the petroleum sector, to receive more income and to provide a better quality of life for his family.

Eliezer appreciates everyone who through their economic resources gives him the opportunity to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his career in Petroleum and Gas Engineering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in ham, shampoo, rice, sweet bread, milk, eggs, sweets, and other items.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes, de 23 años de edad y con grandes aspiraciones en el futuro, el es un joven decidido a enfrentar la realidad de la vida para tener un futuro mejor en el mañana. 

La actividad que el dignamente realiza bajo un sol agotador es de agricultor, la producción que el realiza es la siembra de cebollas que para el es un buen campo para generar buenos ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y comunidad el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 3 años y le ha ido bien en ese negocio en la producción de cebollas. La segunda actividad que realiza es de jornalero en los alrededores de la comunidad.

El uso respectivo que el dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de  de semillas de cebollas y la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para así tener una buena cosecha y poner a las disposición sus productos de la mejor calidad a su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de Roberto es la compra de mas terrenos para la aplicación de sus cultivos que el realiza y realizar la construcción de su propio vivienda para así tener las condiciones de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Agriculture is an activity only suited to people who love the earth as a mother, as an engenderer of future for life. 

With a good future of hope for coming generations, Roberto is 23 years old and has great aspirations for the future. He is a young man determined to face the reality of life for a better future tomorrow.

He farms with dignity under a single farmer. The works he does is the planting of onions, which, because he's a good farmer, earn a good income for supporting his family and improving his family's and community's life conditions. 

He's been doing this work for three years and this onion producing business has gone well. The second activity he does is day labor in the surrounding areas of the community.
