The respective use that he will give the managed credit is for the purchase of onion seeds and buying organic fertilizers in order to have a good harvest and make the highest quality products available to his community. 

One of Roberto's aspirations is the purchase of more land for his crops and building his own house in order to have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories for babies

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zamu is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member.

She has a business selling charcoal and green bananas. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

She works from home six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy land to start farming so as to supplement her income. The family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 41-year-old married mother of three children. She has worked as a tailor for ten years to help her husband cover their family's needs and expenses. Hanaa is a hardworking mother who is trying desperately to provide her family with a better life. She is therefore acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her children's school tuition fees and to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her beloved family. Hanaa hopes to develop her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees and to renovate her house

loans.name: Leticia Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Leticia de 38  años de edad, vive con sus hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 6 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende, arroz, azúcar, manteca, frescos, churros, frijoles, lácteos, jabón, pollo, carnes  etc. vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Leticia es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  como pollo, arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Leticia is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her children. She has had a grocery store for 6 years. In her business she sells rice, sugar, butter, fresh items, churros, beans, dairy products, soap, chicken, meat, etc. She lives in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras. Leticia is an enterprising woman with the desire to be successful and fight every day to improve her quality of life. She seeks a loan to buy products to stock her store such as chicken, rice, beans, flour, butter, soap, fresh items, etc. With the support of this loan she intends on increasing her income and also her quality of life. She is an existing client with the desire to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a well-stocked, good business and at the same time improve her future with her family.
San Lorenzo, Honduras- November 2014.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, flour, butter, soap, fresh items, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Doris Rudy

texts.es:
Doris es una joven estudiante de SENATI, natural de Paramonga, ciudad ubicada a pocos kilométros al norte de Lima, vive junto a su madre y sus 2 hermanas. Su padre falleció cuando ella tenía 5 años. Su madre labora como secretaria en una empresa dedicada a la Metalmecánica. 
Ella empezó a laborar a los 20 años como practicante en el Área de Administración y Almacén y actualmente labora como Asistente de Logística pero  debido al horario y a los cursos que está llevando se le dificulta trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, por lo que le es muy importante contar con el apoyo de KIVA para poder continuar con sus estudios, ya que por la actual situación económica que está pasando su familia, le es muy complicado seguir costeando sus estudios.
Ella es una joven muy emprendedora, feliz con la carrera que está estudiando debido a que siente que tiene la posibilidad de trabajar en diferentes áreas de una empresa y en un futuro le gustaría formar su propia empresa, crecer profesionalmente y ser una persona más productiva para la sociedad para así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella considera que es fundamental brindarle el apoyo a los jóvenes emprendedores para que puedan iniciar o culminar sus estudios superiores sobre todo si son personas que a pesar de tener la capacidad y voluntad para ser grandes profesionales, no cuentan con los medios económicos para lograrlo, pues pagar una carrera profesional en una universidad o instituto superior, requiere una gran inversión. Es por tal razón que está muy agradecida con KIVA e IPFE que tienen la iniciativa de invertir en la educación, sin duda esto dará grandes frutos a futuro.
texts.en:
Doris is a young student in SENATI.  She is a native of Paramonga, a city located a few kilometers north of Lima.  She lives with her mother and her two sisters.  Her father passed when she was five years old.  Her mother works as a secretary in a metalworking business.  Doris started working at the age of 20 in management and retail, but currently she works as a logistics assistant.  However, because of her schedule and the courses that she is currently taking, it has been hard to work and study at the same time.  For this reason, she is hoping for Kiva's support in order to continue with her studies because given her family's current financial situation it is very difficult to continue affording her education.

She is an enterprising young woman who is happy with the career she has chosen because she feels that she has the opportunity to work in different areas of businesses and someday she would like to start her own business, grow professionally and be a more productive member of society so that she can give her family a better quality of life.  She believes that is is essential to support young entrepreneurs so that they can start and finish their education, especially if they are people who are capable and willing to be successful but do not have the resources to do so since paying for a college education requires a huge investment.  For this reason, she is very grateful for Kiva and IPFE who are investing in education, which will doubtlessly produce great results in the future.

loans.use: pay off her remaining debt and continue studying.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Iloilo, Philippines. Edna helps her husband in their fishing business, which has been their source of income for several years.

Edna is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters and plywood to repair the fishing boat. This will enable Edna and her husband to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Edna hopes to make their fishing business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters and plywood to repair the fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop his business by renewing his tools and requested machines

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Shehu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Poulina, Penihas and Isuwa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shehu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Shehu  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en: Rahama is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahama joined Babban Gona, primarily to create a better future for her children, Sisiliya, Yakubu, and Ibrahim. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahama would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahama can now store her maize at harvest time. She can sell it a few months later, at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Rahama spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, and of her hope to make more money for herself and her family, eventually.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba Momher is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Habiba Momher joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Sadic and Juspen.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Habiba Momher would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habiba Momher can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Habiba Momher  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is 42 years old, and he lives in Vanadzor city, of Lori region. He has no higher education, but he manages to sustain his family's needs, through his own skills and abilities. Near his house he built a garage where he repairs cars. He has been engaged in this work already 20 years. During these years he managed to have a lot of regular customers, who trust him for his good work and the quickness of it. Edik is married, and he has a son who is now in the army performing his military service, and a daughter who is a student.

Edik hopes to have this loan, since he wants to repair his workplace (his garage), and he also wants to bring car parts from Georgia to sell. In this way, he will be able to have both more clients and better income.

loans.use: to repair his workplace (his garage), and to obtain car parts from Georgia to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old married Palestinian refugee. He has lived and worked as a barber in a Palestinian camp since he was born. Mahmoud is a hardworking man. He established his own business in 2006, after he had good experience in this domain when forced to quit school during his intermediate classes to financially support his parents. He puts in much effort to develop his family's living conditions. Unfortunately, his business inside the camp is limited and he has to do something new to attract more customers.

Mahmoud's income is barely enough to cover his family's living expenses. He has acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to add necessary decorations to his shop, update his tools, and buy special hair treatment products to attract customers' attention. He is very anxious about this loan and is looking forward to starting the decoration project to accept the new year in with an attractive business decoration and an increase in income.

loans.use: to add necessary decorations to his shop, update his tools, and buy special hair treatment products to attract customers' attention

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 30-year-old single man who has operated a computer repair shop for three years. He is working hard to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Mohammad is an ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to add an international call center to his shop, as he wants to increase his business merchandise with a new collection of phones. This loan will help Mohammad satisfy his customers' needs and increase his income. Mohammad hopes to develop his business more in the future by adding a phone repair service to his shop.

loans.use: to add an international call center to his shop and to increase his business merchandise with a new collection of phones

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es: Abelino es un hombre de 55 años de edad que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar, por medio de su negocio de venta de productos básicos actividad que realiza desde hace 33 años, por lo que es reconocido entre sus vecinos por la amabilidad y la economía con la distribuye sus productos. Él habita en vivienda propia desde hace 30 años, al lado de su esposa. Abelino desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI el cual le permita realizar una inversión en productos para su negocio tales como: jabón, detergente, champú, papel higiénico, huevos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, etc. Esperando poder contar con el apoyo de este crédito para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Abelino is 55 years old and maintains his household through his business selling basic necessities which he has been doing for 33 years. He is recognized among his neighbors for his friendliess and the affordability of the products he distributes. He's lived in his own home with his wife for the past 30 years. 

Abelino wishes to acquire a loan through FUSAI which would allow him to make an investment in products for his business such as: soap, detergent, shampoo, toilet paper, eggs, sugar, rice, beans, etc. He's counting on the support from this loan to achieve this.

loans.use: To invest in: soap, detergent, shampoo, toilet paper, eggs, sugar, rice, beans, etc...

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi  Luz Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Jehová es mi Luz lo integran tres microempresarias esforzadas, quien lo coordina es la señora Milagro, una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, su negocio es la venta de ropa y electrodomésticos en su comunidad desde hace ocho años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalón, short, camisetas, blusas, vestidos, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos, es el noveno ciclo que la socia solicita el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. El resto de los integrantes es la señora Marta de 49 años de edad dedicada a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado municipal, y Angélica una joven de 23 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años.
texts.en: The solidarity group Jehová is my Light is composed of three hardworking micro-enterprises and is coordinated by Milagro, a 39 year old woman who is married and the mother of three children who are her primary motivation. For 8 years her business has sold clothing and appliances in her community. She is seeking this loan to purchase pants, shorts, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc. With her previous loans she has been able to diversify the products she offers. This is the 9th loan cycle that she is using to seek financing for her business and she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person. The remaining members of the group are Marta, who is 49 years old and works selling fruits in the town market, and Angélica, a young 23 year old woman who has owned a grocery store for three years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise because this is one of the seasons that requires more of these items.

loans.name: Elesha

texts.en:
Elesha owns and operates a vulcanizing shop. She offers services like tire repair. She is a 34-year-old married woman with three children ages 8, 2 and 2 months old. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte.

Elesha is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for maintenance like oil lubrication, cleaning kits and other related materials. She could now continue operating her vulcanizing shop, providing quality services to her respective customers. In this way, she could attract more customers to drop by her shop.

In the future, Elesha dreams of improving her business to make it productive and profitable for her to provide for the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy materials for maintenance like oil lubrication, cleaning kits and other related materials.

loans.name: Adeliza

texts.en:
Adeliza is a married woman, and she has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old, and she has one child who is currently in school.

Adeliza has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional raw materials for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. Adeliza would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Lep's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Lep is 54 years old and a mother of six children. To earn a living, she grows rice on two hectares. Moreover, her husband is a house builder able to earn more income to help support the family.

Having repaid her previous loans, Lep is requesting her fourth one with VisionFund as the leader of a two-member group. She will spend her loan portion to pay the harvesting fee for her rice crop. Lep hopes to harvest on time and earn more income to help support her family.

loans.use: to pay the harvesting fee for her rice farm

loans.name: La'azaru

texts.en: La'azaru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. La'azaru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yunusa, Daniel and Zachariah.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azaru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, La'azaru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aldyn

texts.es: Aldyn: Es una mujer indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas; es alegre y luchadora, tiene 46 años de edad, casada con ocho hijos: 4 son mayores de edad y 4 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de marisco de manera ambulante, generando sus ingresos propios con lo cual aporta económicamente en el hogar. Ante la dificultad de no tener garantías materiales, para acceder al crédito formó parte del grupo solidario, por un periodo de 6 años, ahora que ha ido mejorando sus ingresos, ha ido adquiriendo bienes materiales como electrodomésticos que ya puede poner en garantía, por lo que se ha desligado del Grupo Solidario y está solicitando un crédito individual para poder comprar más pescados y camarones para vender en los barrios de Bilwi. Sueña con llegar a tener una tienda donde también oferte productos básicos y otros productos.
texts.en:
Aldyn, 46, is an indigenous woman from Puerto Cabezas who belongs to the Miskito ethnic group.  She's happy and determined.  She's married and has eight children, four adults and four teenagers who attend secondary school.  She has sold shrimp as a street vendor for 10 years, earning her own income to contribute financially to the household.  

Faced with the problem of not having any material goods, she joined a communal bank for six years so she could get loans.  Now that her income has been improving, she has been acquiring material goods like home appliances that she's able to use as collateral, so she has left the communal bank.

Aldyn's requesting an individual loan to be able to buy more fish and shrimp to sell in the neighborhoods of Bilwi.

She dreams of having a store where she can also sell basic staples and other products.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp to sell in the neighborhoods of Bilwi

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She takes care of additional family members. Betty has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products at the market on a retail basis. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenge includes seasonality of clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build permanent business premises. Betty lives in her own house and has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a married woman and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, and both of her children are currently in school.

Angeline has a buy-and-sell used clothing business, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase additional used clothing to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Angeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolás de 40 años de edad, cuenta con 7 hijos, los primeros 3 ya tienen familia separada y los cuatro últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad, el es un hombre emprendedor que no le importa qué actividad realizar sino lo único que a el le importa es tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia.

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la elaboración, compra y venta de ropa típica en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que el a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de jornalero en su comunidad y por medio de esa actividad el puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

El es muy emprendedor en la vida y es por ello que el se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa típica y hilos para la elaboración de cortes típicas, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta. La aspiración más importante de el es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos para que ellos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Nicolas, 40 years old, has 7 children. The first 3 already have their own families and the last 4 are excellent students in their community school. He is an entrepreneurial man who does not care what work is done but what matters to him is to have an income for the benefit of his family.

His productive work which generates earnings in his financial system is the creation, buying and selling of traditional clothing in his community since it is the only way that he has found to be able to to have an income for his family. His second job is working as a day laborer in his community. By way of this work he can have other additional income in order to sustain his family and to provide a proper quality of life to his children so that they will become good professionals in the workplace.

He is very entrepreneurial in life and this is why he decided to get a loan to buy goods for traditional clothing and thread to make traditional cuttings to have more merchandise available for the customers of his respective shops. His most important goal is the construction of a better home and to give a good education to his children so that they can become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy goods for traditional clothing and thread.

loans.name: Sreynat's Group

texts.en: Sreynat resides in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 47 years old and a mother of three children. She earns an income to support her family by growing cassava and rice. This is Sreynat's sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. Sreynat is the leader of this three-member loan group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and to pay for labor. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Guatemala es reconocido por su gente trabajadora con el deseo de superación en la vida que toma las cosas como un tero en la vida para poder llegar a realizar grandes logros en la vida es el caso de Manuel que se a tenido que ingeniar en como tener un ingreso económico par su familia el tiene 19 años de edad soltero y tiene ese deseo de superar en la vida.

La actividad principal de el es la albañilería en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender a construir casas de su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 3 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la compra de herramientas de construcción en la albañilería ya que es de importancia para el y sin esas herramientas el no podrá trabajar para seguir construyendo en su comunidad.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de el es poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro e la construcción de su propia casa para tener las condiciones de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Guatemala is known for its hard-working people with the desire to be successful in life that take things on as a challenge in life in order to be able to realize big accomplishments in life. This is the case of Manuel who has had to create a source of income for his family. He is 19 years old, single, and has the desire to be successful in life. He works as a bricklayer in his community, and has been doing this for 3 long years of sacrifice but it has made him very proud because he does what he needs to do to provide income to meet his family's need and for the development of the community in which he lives.

The loan will be used to buy construction tools to be used in bricklaying as it is important for him and without these tools he won't be able to continue building in his community. One of the biggest dreams he has is to open his own construction service in his community and the development in the future and building of his own home in order to have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusuf joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Alhamdu, Lidiya and Rahab.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusuf spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 33-year-old, single Palestinian refugee. He has been living and working in a Palestinian camp, in Lebanon, since he was born. Mohamad works in a construction business. He has been a builder since 2005. He is working hard to develop his business and increase his income, through working outside the camp.

Mohamad is planning to have his own family. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to built his own house. This will help to make his dream of having his own family come true.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his business, and he will work hard to expand his working region to cover nearby villages.

loans.use: to build his own house, to make his dream of having his own family come true.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Nura joined Babban Gona, primarily to create a better future for his children, Mustapha, Maryamu, and Bahijja. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nura would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nura can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Nura spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and his hope to ensure that eventually his children will be educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: galvanized sheets, cement, and sand to swap out the roof and repair the walls of his home.

loans.name: Maitala

texts.en:
Maitala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maitala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Ruth, Ladi and Orpha.  Before he became a member, Maitala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maitala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Maitala spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children; he hopes to eventually make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chain-link, cement posts, and the labor to install a chain-link fence around the edges of her property.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is a resident of Iloilo, Philippines. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. Jenefer works with her husband in their fishing business. This has been the source of their income for the past 10 years now.

Jenefer is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and outriggers. Jenefer hopes that this loan will help them improve their catch, which will allow them to sell more fish in the market. 

In the future, Jenefer hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and outriggers

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Pao, 30, lives with family members in a rural area of the Battambang province. She is a mother of two children; one is in school, and one is too young. For her living, Pao can earn income by growing rice on three hectares of farmland. Moreover, she earns more income via sesame growing.

This is the first time for Pao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for farm labor. She hopes that she can get a greater yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Charito has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Naty

texts.es: Naty vive en concubinato desde hace 8 años y tiene dos hijos Ella y su familia viven en la comunidad de UMAPUSA en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad y solo tiene luz y agua Naty obtiene ingresos de la elaboracion de queso y agricultura y quiere un prestamo para comprar una vaca que le ayude a incrementar su produccion de leche, aunque la pareja de Naty trabaja como chofer en una cooperativa minera, lo que ambos ganan no es suficiente, por eso Naty quiere un prestamo, ella goza de buena salud y su evaluación es prometedora
texts.en:
Naty has been in a common-law relationship for eight years. She has two children. Naty and her family live in the community of Umapusa. They have a brick and cement house that receives only electricity and running water. Naty earns income from making cheese and farming.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow, which will help to increase milk production. Although Naty’s partner works as a driver for a mining cooperative, the two of them do not generate sufficient income. For this reason, Naty wants to apply for a loan. She enjoys good health and her evaluation is promising.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in laminated galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and wire to construct a better house of laminate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, rebar, etc., to plaster the walls and finish the pillars of her residence.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta gives thanks for her first Kiva loan, which helped her to buy medicine for her disabled children. Marta lives with her large family in the village of Geghamavan in the Gegharkunik region. She has three children, two daughters and a son. Marta has a cute farm where she works with her husband and in this way, earns their family's living.  On her farm, Marta has 40 cows, two calves, a heifer, five sheep and 30 chickens. Her farm products she sells to her regular customers and some she uses for her family's needs. She says that she is really a very optimistic person and she never stops hoping that all her hardships are temporary. She works hard and as she says, tiredness for her is not familiar, but she was mistaken. Recently, she found out that she has problems with her health.

This loan amount she asks for is to pay for a treatment course; she will pass the health treatment course. This she is doing since she promised her children she would take care of her health because they want their mother to be healthy and smiling, despite great hardships in her life.

loans.use: to pay for a health treatment course

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Ruth, Naomi and Orpha. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Abigail would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abigail can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Abigail  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Crecelyn

texts.en:
Crecelyn is a married woman, and she has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 25 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Crecelyn has an abaca weaving business, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more materials for her business, like abaca fiber, rope, etc.

She has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her work, like abaca fiber and rope.

loans.name: Edilina

texts.en:
Edilina is 46 years old and married. She has five children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.

Edilina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business selling firewood and charcoal, in the Philippines.

Felisa has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase a stock of firewood to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years, now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

Felisa would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Eduardo

texts.es:
Guatemala es reconocido por su gente trabajadora con el deseo de superación en la vida que toma las cosas como un tero en la vida para poder llegar a realizar grandes logros en la vida es el caso de Manuel que se a tenido que ingeniar en como tener un ingreso económico par su familia el tiene 24 años de edad soltero y tiene ese deseo de superar en la vida.

La actividad principal de el es la albañilería en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender a construir casas de su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 5 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la compra de herramientas de construcción en la albañilería ya que es de importancia para el y sin esas herramientas el no podrá trabajar para seguir construyendo en su comunidad.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de el es poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro e la construcción de su propia casa para tener las condiciones de vida adecuada y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Guatemala is known for its hard-working people with the desire to be successful in life that take things on as a challenge in life in order to be able to realize big accomplishments in life. This is the case of Manuel who has had to create a source of income for his family. Manuel is 24 years old, single, and has the desire to be successful in life. His primary work is being a bricklayer in the community where he lives. Since he was a boy he made the decision to build houses in his community. He has been working for 5 long years, sacrificing, but he has done so with pride because he does it for his family that needs income in order to pay for the family's needs and for the development of the community in which he lives.

The loan will be used to buy construction tools to be used in bricklaying as it is important for him and without these tools he won't be able to continue building in his community. One of the biggest dreams he has is to open his own construction service in his community and the development in the future and building of his own home in order to have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricklaying tools.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Victoria joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Roben, Mubarak, and Orpha. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Victoria would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Victoria can now store her maize at harvest time. She can sell it a few months later, at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Victoria spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, and her hope eventually to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood in order to repair a room in her home.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She has no additional family member.

She has sold green bananas in the market on a retail basis for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more bunches of green bananas. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to buy a van to reduce transportation costs. She would also like to buy land to start farming so as to supplement her income.

She lives in her own house with access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Alvaro  tiene la edad de 50 años y esta casado, sus hijos y su esposa con su razón de vivir, ya que considera que es lo mas importante que tiene a su lado. Con el crédito el quiere asistir mejor su cafetal con el fin de recoger una mejor cosecha el próximo año y así poder vivir mas libre económicamente además poder dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia, además de tener la satisfacción de ver su cafetal convertido en una plantación mucho mas productiva y sana.
texts.en: Alvaro is 50 years old and is married. His children and wife are the reason of his life, because he considers them the most important thing he has with him. With the loan he wants to attend his coffee crop so he can have a better harvest next year and be able to live more freely financially. Moreover, he will be able to give a better level of life to his family, and also have the satisfaction of seeing his coffee crop become a more productive and healthy plantation.

loans.use: to help his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to start selling cosmetics.

loans.name: Luz Teresa

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.
En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 65 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, todos  aun viven con ella. 
Doña Luz es una gran mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y gallinas criollas  en  un pequeño corral, ella compra estos animalitos pequeños y los mantiene por espacio de tres meses tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen crecimiento para luego venderlos a vecinos del lugar,  así ella se gana algo sin salir de su casa de una forma honesta.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas  para los pollos y gallinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son aumentar su produccion.
texts.en:
At the Ayacucho Parish of the Santa Ana canton, the loan group of Amigas Por Siempre meets every fifteen days. This place is known for its great vegetation, but above all, for its beautiful, sweet water spas that are frequently visited by local tourists, and also those from other cities. 
This is the place where Luz lives. She is 65 years old, she is divorced, and from that relationship she has three children who are adults, and who still live with her. 
Luz is a great woman who likes to work to get ahead. She makes a living breeding chickens and Creole hens in a small pen. She buys these animals when they are young and then keeps them for a span of three months, enough time so they have suitable growth to later sell them to others in the neighborhood. In this way, she makes some money without leaving her home in an honest way.
This loan is to buy feed and medicines for the chickens and hens, so they can have good development. She has been in the loan group for 12 years, and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dreams are to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for chickens and hens.

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie is 30 years old and has six children. She is married, and five of her children are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.

Floramie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig-fattening for five years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gina is 48 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Gina has a flower and candle vending business in the Philippines. Gina requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more flowers and candles to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gina has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more flowers and candles to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 33 years old. He is married and has four children, aged between 3 and 9 years. All of them go to school. Fidele is a farmer; he has been farming for two years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for maize [corn]. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for the family's consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his maize crop.

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en: Ummaru is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ummaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ummaru can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ummaru is looking to earn a better income, to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ivette

texts.es: Ivette tiene un novio y un hijo ella vive con sus padres en la ciudad de El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Ivette se dedica a la venta de productos de salud (cremas, shampoos, lociones, tónicos) y esta vez necesita un credito para comprar productos de la marca o la linea For Ever, de esa manera ella asegura incrementar sus ventas. Aunque la madre y el padre de Ivette trabajan, la situacion economica de la familia es dificil. Por eso Ivette quiere que le ayuden porque planea independizarse Ivette no tiene una tienda, ella hace visitas a domicilio por el momento.
texts.en:
Ivette has a boyfriend and a son. She lives with her parents in a brick and cement house in the city of El Alto. Ivette sells health products such as creams, shampoos, lotions, and tonics. At this time, she needs a loan in order to buy products of the “For Ever” brand so that she can increase her sales.

Even though her father and mother are working, the financial situation for Ivette’s family is difficult. For this reason, Ivette would like assistance because she plans to become independent. She does not have a store, so she must conduct sales calls at her customers’ homes at the moment.

loans.use: to buy beauty products of the "For Ever" brand.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 22-year-old married lady who has been working as an English teacher since almost two years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her students for being lovable and professional.

Amina is also a sacrificing woman who got pregnant with her first child and is working hard to provide her child with better life. Thus today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to cover her childbirth expenses.

Amina hopes to get a promotion in her work, as she wishes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to cover her childbirth expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of sweet rolls to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Puerto, Cortes. Tiene casi 8 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de venta de mercaderia como camisas, blusas, boxer, sosten para damas. Ella vende su producto de manera ambulante y por pedidos en la misma comunidad. Este pequeño negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversion de varios prestamos, el que solicita actualmente es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar blusas, pantalones, ropa intima y camisas para la venta y aprovechar esta temporada de fin de año. Su meta es aumentar los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Emerita is 34 years old, she is married with four children, and she lives in a town in the municipality of Puerto, Cortes. She has worked at her own business selling merchandise such as shirts, blouses, boxers and women's bras for almost 8 years. She sells her product from door to door, and takes requests within her community.

Her small business has been kept stable because of investments from several loans, which is why she is currently requesting 15,000 lempiras to purchase blouses, pants, under garments and shirts to sell and to take advantage of the end-of-year season. Her goal is to increase her income to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, under garments and shirts to sell in this end-of-the-year season.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia engages in a retail rice type of business. She sells rice to the neighborhood in the community. She is 58 years old and a married woman with one grown child. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years now.

Due to scarcity of capital, Virgilia has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy 20 sacks of rice. Because of this tool, she can now operate and cater for the needs of her respective buyers.

In the future, Virgilia will try her best to improve and manage her business successfully for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of rice

loans.name: Abduljalal

texts.en: Abduljalal is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abduljalal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abduljalal can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Abduljalal is looking to earn a better income, to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en:
Matta is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Matta joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Shitu, Zakaria and Hussaina.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Matta would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matta can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Matta spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hauwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Jeneth, Grace and Zeruya.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Hauwa spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isabel Lucas

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 31 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida por poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya es casado y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. 

Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 10 años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que ella cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Isabel is 31 years old. She is an enterprising and determined woman who works to overcome obstacles. She does not give up when life presents obstacles but reaches toward her goals and dreams. She has three children to support. The first is already married and the last two are excellent students in their community school.

She gets her income through the cultivation of bananas in the community where she lives. Her parents taught her this activity when she was ten years old. She makes sales of her product in the market and around her community. She then has an income to improve the living conditions of her family. 

She will use this loan to maintain her bananas because it is very important to her that her plants produce premium banana fruits so she does not lose her customers.

One of her great aspirations she has is to plant more bananas and see her children grow, get an education, and become professionals in life, and to improve the lives of her family in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to maintain her bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting, gravel, and iron to construct a water storage basin with a washing area and put a roof over the washing area

loans.name: Daysi Jeanneth

texts.es:
Daysi  es una mujer ecuatoriana  de 44 años de edad,  es viuda desde hace varios años, gracias al esfuerzo que han hecho sus padres ella pudo completar sus estudios secundarios ya que por motivos económicos no le fue posible estudiar la universidad, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para ella sobresalir.
A pesar de todo ella tiene un restaurante, un trabajo que demanda mucho esfuerzo y tiempo sobre esto ella se dedica mucho para poder salir adelante y  sobresalir en esta vida, el arte de la cocina lo aprendió de su madre, prepara exclusivamente almuerzos y meriendas gracias a todo lo que ella ha hecho su negocio es propio y lo tiene un año. Además  ella prepara  platos típicos españoles, ya que lo aprendió o el tiempo que vivió en España como migrante, y hace mas de cinco años que regresó.
 Su estado civil la ha llevado a vivir de manera independiente un año y medio, su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en el Barrio Gualundún la misma que está en la  ciudad de Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi
Su negocio está ubicado en el mismo lugar de su vivienda  esto es beneficioso ya que existe mucho movimiento y ella puede ofrecer sus servicios a toda la gente que transita constantemente por ahí.
Daysi agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral ya que ella invertirá en la remodelación de su local  obtener más ingresos y brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daysi is a 44-year old Ecuadoran. She has been a widow for a few years. Thanks to her parents' efforts, she was able to complete her secondary schooling. For financial reasons, however, she wasn't able to study at the university level. But that hasn't been an obstacle to her success.

In spite of everything, Daysi owns a restaurant. It's work that requires a lot of time and effort. Daysi puts in a lot of both to get ahead and be successful in life. She learned the culinary arts from her mother. She exclusively prepares lunches and snacks. She also makes typical Spanish dishes, which she learned in the time she lived as a migrant in Spain. She came back to Ecuador over five years ago. Thanks to everything she has done, Daysi owns her restaurant outright and has for one year.

Daysi's marital status has lead her to live independently for a year and a half. Her home is in the Gualundún neighborhood of Latacunga in Cotopaxi Province. Daysi's business is situated in her home. This is a beneficial arrangement, as there is a lot of coming and going near her home and she can offer her services to everyone who is constantly traveling through the area.

Daysi is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in her work life. She will invest in remodeling her restaurant so she can earn more income and offer better customer service.

loans.use: to remodel her restaurant, which will help her earn a better income and offer better service to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 29 años  de edad, está soltera y aun vive en casa de sus padres junto a otros hermanos menores. 
Doña María  para poder obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir a los gastos que genera su casa se dedica al comercio, ella  en sociedad con su papá se dedican a la venta de calzado, ellos tienen un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, hay días que ella trabaja sola y otros con la ayuda de su papá ya que a veces el tiene que salir a otras ciudades a comprar mercadería. Ella lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad y su papá más de 30 años con los cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y zapatillas en varios modelos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the loan group Alfa meet every two weeks.

In this place lives Señorita Maria. She is 29 years old. She is single and still lives in the house of her parents, along with her younger siblings. 

Doña Maria, in order to obtain her own resources and with them be able to contribute to the expenses that the household generates, works in business. She sells footwear, in partnership with her father. They have a little stall in the center of the city of Portoviejo. They work from Monday to Saturday, from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. There are days when she works alone and others when she has her father's help, since sometimes he has to go to other cities to buy merchandise. She has been working in this business for 6 years, and her father, for more than 30 years, during which time they have been getting ahead.

This loan is to buy shoes and high-heel shoes in various styles. She has been in the loan group for more than 4 years, and she likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans. Her dreams are to have a big shop.

loans.use: to buy shoes and high-heeled shoes to sell.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: Margoth  tiene la edad de 19 años, vive en unión libre, y tiene 1 hijo que junto a su esposo son su mayor prioridad. Con el crédito ella junto a su esposo quieren comprar materiales, insumos y abonos para crear un almacigo de café el cual van a utilizar para reemplazar algunas matas que se han muerto en su cafetal, así como sembrar una nueva arrea de café, y si les sobra algunas matas se lo van a vender a los vecinos de la comunidad, su objetivo principal es lograr tener una mejor plantación para los próximos años, que les permita tener mas cosecha y mejores ingresos, esto para lograr tener una mejor condición de vida tanto para ellos como para su hijo.
texts.en: Margoth is 19-years old.  She is married and has one son who, along with her husband, is her first priority.  With the loan, Margoth and her husband want to buy materials, supplies and fertilizers to grow coffee seedlings.  They will use the seedlings to replace some plants on their coffee farm that have died.  They also want to plant a new area with coffee.  If they have some plants left over, they will sell the plants to neighbors in their community.  Margoth's main objective is to have an improved coffee farm in the coming years, one that will allow them to have a larger harvest and more income so they, as well as their son, can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to grow seedlings.

loans.name: Maria Doney

texts.es: Maria Doney  tiene la edad de 47 años, esta casada, y tiene 6 hijo que son su mayor prioridad. Con el credito ella quiere comprar abono y algunos otros insumos para dar mantenimiento a su cafetal. Tiene casi toda su vida de dedicarse al cultivo de café ayudada por su esposo y sus hijos, una de sus mayores inspiraciones es poder tener un mejor cafetal para poder dar una mejor condición económica a su familia y poderle dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Doney is 47 years old, married, and she has six children who are her first priority. 

She wants to use the loan to buy fertilizer and other inputs to maintain her coffee plantation. She has cultivated coffee nearly all her life, and she is helped by her husband and children.

One of Maria's greatest motivations is to improve her coffee crops so that she can provide a better financial situation for her family and a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and inputs to maintain the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Estrella Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 26, 24 y 13 años de edad, el menor  estudia en colegio, todos ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es técnico en refrigeración. 
Doña Estrella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y otros productos de catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana pero también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, allí vende todos los días, la mayoría de sus ventas es por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante junto a su querida familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar camisas, pantalones y otras prendas. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the lending group Alfa meets in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the home of the royal tamarinds. Estrella, 44, lives here. She is married and has three children ages 26, 24 and 13; the youngest is in high school. They all still live at home. Her husband is a refrigerator technician.

In order to make her own money and help her husband with the household expenses, Estrella sells all types of clothing and other products from catalogs. She sells door to door, going out two or three times a week, but she also sells in her home to her better-known customers. She works from home every day and most of her sales come from orders that those customers make. She sells on credit and collects payment twice a month. She's been doing this for 5 years to help her family get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy shirts, pants and other garments. She's been with the lending group for 5 years and likes it because the loans are helpful. Her dream is to have a well-located store.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants and other garments.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than five years now.

Rosie is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine, lead weights, and fishing nets. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Rosie hopes to make their fishing business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, lead weights, and fishing nets

loans.name: Lederia

texts.en:
Lederia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell to her customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lederia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a maize farmer from Sarkin Dawa village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Solomon would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Solomon can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Solomon, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is a 23-year-old single lady who is working hard to achieve her dreams and graduate with an architectural degree. 

She is currently working in an architectural company and has been since 2013, to enhance her skills, and make sure that after she graduates she will have special talents and expertise that will help her in spreading her talents.

Nadine is acquiring her current loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay her university's increasing tuition fees.

She is working hard to open her own architectural company which would be a dream to come true.

loans.use: To pay her university's increasing tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks

loans.name: Génesis Nicoless

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señorita Génesis, tiene 20 años  de edad, está soltera y aun vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia Administración de Empresas en una universidad de la localidad,
Doña Génesis es una joven muy trabajadora que además de estar dedicada a sus estudios también se dedica al comercio para ganarse lo suyo y así poder seguir estudiando esperando forjarse un mejor porvenir, ella tiene un local en la casa de los padres donde vende ropa de todos tipo, ella junto a su madre se encargan del negocio ya que ella tiene que salir a estudiar, también les  vende a sus compañeras de estudios ya que son muy venas clientes, tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante en sus estudios.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva año y medio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos, the loan group Alfa meets every fifteen days. 
This is the place where Génesis lives, she is 20 years old, she is single, and she still lives at home with her parents. She studies Business Administration in a local university.
Génesis is a hard-working young woman, who besides being dedicated to her studies, also makes a living with sales to earn some money for herself, and be able to keep studying, hoping to make a better future. She has a shop in her parents’ house, where she sells all kinds of clothing. She takes care of the business together with her mother, since she has to go to school. She also sells to her classmates, because they are very good customers. She has had this occupation for more than 4 years, which allows her to succeed with her studies. 
This loan is to purchase all sorts of clothing. She has been with the loan group for a year and a half, and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dreams are to finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell. In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 34 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene 4 hijos el primer hijo que el tiene ya tiene vida independiente y los 3 últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 15 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 34, is an entrepreneur and is determined to overcome things in his life. He doesn't give up in the face of obstacles but reaches his goals and dreams. He has four children - his oldest son is independent and the other three are excellent students in the local school.

Manuel works in banana production in the community where he lives. His parents taught him the trade 15 years ago. He sells his product in the market and in surrounding communities. The income allows him to improve living conditions for his family.

He will use this loan to maintain his banana crop, since it's very important that his banana plants produce high-quality fruits so that he doesn't lose customers. One of his great aspirations is to plant more banana trees, and to see his children grow in their education and become professionals.

loans.use: to maintain his banana crop.

loans.name: Iván Enrique

texts.es: Iván es un emprendedor joven de 22 años de edad, reside en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de barranquilla, en él funciona su negocio de tienda de víveres y tiene más de dos años comercializando todo lo referente a la canasta familiar; arroz, aceite, legumbres, verduras, carnes, frutas, entre otros. Su idea de negocio inicio por el consejo de su tío, quien tiene también una tienda de víveres y le recomendó dedicarse a esta misma actividad, fue entonces que tomó la determinación de colocar a funcionar su negocio.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio y transeúntes del sector quienes realizan sus compras de contado o a crédito, en los horarios de atención de 6:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. todos los días.  Iván realiza sus compras y cancela de contado en el mercado público y depósitos mayoristas de Barranquilla. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo capital que utilizará en la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, legumbres, verduras, carnes, frutas, para surtir su negocio.  El flujo de caja de su tienda de viveres es bastante dinámico lo que permite la reinversión para tener un buen stock de productos y garantizar una buena afluencia de las ventas.  Iván tiene metas familiares y para su negocio las cuales se encaminan en pro de mejorar su calidad de vida.  Su gran desafío es incrementar sus ventas y fidelizar a sus clientes ofreciéndoles buenos precios y excelente servicio,  lo que permitiría mejorar sus ganancias y con ello poder comprar a futuro el local donde tiene la tienda de víveres, con ello garantizaría un ahorro en sus costos fijos.
texts.en:
Iván is an enterprising young man. He is 22-years old and lives in a neighborhood to the southwest of Barranquilla. That is also where he has his general store. For more than two years, he has been selling everything for a family's basic needs: rice, cooking oil, legumes, vegetables, meat, fruit and other items.

Ivan got the idea for starting his business on the advice of his uncle, who also has a small grocery. He recommended that Ivan make his living in the same business. That is when Ivan became determined to open his own store. Ivan's main customers are people from the neighborhood and passers-by. His customers either pay cash or buy on credit. Ivan's store is open from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. every day. He makes his purchases and pays his bills in the public markets and wholesale warehouses in Barranquilla.

Ivan is currently requesting a credikiva, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the capital to purchase supplies, such as rice, cooking oil, legumes, vegetables, meat and fruit to stock up his business. His cash flow is quite dynamic, which allows him to reinvest in a good stock of products and guarantees a good amount of sales.

Iván has familial goals and work-related goals, which guide him toward improving his quality of life. His greatest challenges are increasing his sales and building customer loyalty by offering good prices and excellent service. This would allow him to improve his profits and with that to purchase his storefront at a future time. That would guarantee a savings in his fixed costs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, cooking oil, legumes, vegetables, meat, and fruit to stock up his business.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Dogon Awo village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, 

He can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Yakubu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.
