loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kareen

texts.en:
Kareen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Kareen is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a firewood and charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell.

Kareen has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc roofing and wood

loans.name: Lenecia

texts.en:
Lenecia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lenecia is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lenecia has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Lenecia has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 43-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses by machine in his nearby town. He has been recruiting the skilled people for embroidery work on daily wages. He also brings some material home for Sumaira, because she helps him in the embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to cope; the demand of bridal dresses is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advanced.

She requires some capital to buy desired inventories for her husband, but she does not have sufficient cash in hand. So she did humbly request of BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan, her husband would be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's embroidery work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy suits and school shoes for her son’s graduation.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 26-year-old married Syrian citizen, and a father of two children. He works hard to provide them with the necessary living needs. He has been employed in a tailoring factory since 2004, with fourteen years of experience in this domain, since he used to work with his family in Syria after he had to quit school during his Intermediate level and join the family business.

Husein is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing himself and his family's living. His acquired income is a limited monthly salary, which is barely enough to cover their living expenses. Thus, for this reason he thought of starting his own small business, as additional income. To take this step forward, he needs extra capital, which obviously he currently can't afford. That's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to start his own clothes selling business, to increase his income and develop his family's living, especially before the coming Christmas and New Year seasons. He hopes that in the future, he can buy his own shop, diversify his products and expand his working sector.

loans.use: To start his own clothes selling business to increase his income and develop his family's living, especially before the coming Christmas and New Year seasons

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Sandra has been in the business for more than six years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Sandra is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Sandra hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and for the reinvestment of the same business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and animal feed

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marivic is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell for her fruit vending business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Bala

texts.en: Bala is a maize farmer from Sarkin Dawa Village in Kaduna State. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Bala, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 48-year-old married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a butcher shop; he earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy meat from the market and sell it. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy meat for reselling. Nazia wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase meat for reselling at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Micah Musa

texts.en: Micah Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Abu and Ads.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price during harvest. When asked, Micah Musa spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thus reducing pressure to sell corn at low prices during harvest.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma is a 47-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. Erma has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. Fishing is a lucrative venture in their place. Erma wants to improve their fishing business, but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this, Erma and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus allowing them to sell more fish to the market. In the future, Erma hopes of making their fishing business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, outriggers and floaters for her fishing business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Mercy has been in this business for one year. Mercy earns more income from food vending.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Roselyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 53 years old and married.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft drinks, beers, canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Rosario has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from basket weaving.

Rosario aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft drinks, beers, canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nua Ngam 5 Group

texts.en:
For four years, Mrs. Lom, 29, has been a single mom of two girls who are now 10 and 12 years old. After the divorce, she has started her new life and provided for her children independently. They live together in a small low-roofed house with very limited access to necessary facilities. Mrs. Lom has worked very hard to struggle with the life of deprivation, and in spite of the hardship, she is very optimistic and proud of her daughters because they could attend school fully with good results.

Without being trained for work, and because of dropping out of school early, Mrs. Lom can only work at agricultural production.  It is unstable and generates low income, because of the harsh condition of nature, and the lack of access to modern techniques in farming. However, with the experience in farming that she has accumulated since she was very little, and through the training and counselling she has gotten from the Anh Chi Em program, she's actually doing great at cultivating rice, corn, cassava, and raising pigs and chickens. 

This is the fifth time she has taken out a loan from the program, and she will use it to buy corn seeds and fertilizer for the cornfield. She is thankful for the support of the program, which is timely and helpful to her. She dreams her children will escape from poverty and have an abundant life. In the picture, she wears the blue traditional Lao dress and stands on the first row, the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer for the cornfield

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 56-year-old married father of four children. He is a Palestinian refugee who has been working in furniture making since 1980. Youssef is well known in his region with his special talents in his domain and commitment. He is a man of word and recommended by most of his clients.

Youssef is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a special updated furniture-making machine that will develop his business and improve his production. Youssef is working hard to keep on developing his business, to buy his own working place in the future, and save renting fees.

loans.use: To buy a special updated furniture-making machine that will develop his business and improve his production

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 29 years old. He is married with two children aged one and three years; neither of them attend school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize for sale.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 41 years old and has five children; two children are currently in school. She is married. Sylvia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom who are currently in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Safa Group

texts.en:
Aisha is the featured borrower for Safa Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time. Aisha is a 32-year-old married mother of five children, who ten years ago started working in agriculture with her husband, to increase their income and thus cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Aisha is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start selling cleaning materials to improve her family's living conditions. Aisha is an ambitious woman who is sacrificing and trying hard to satisfy the increasing needs of her beloved family.

Aisha is the lady sitting in the middle of the photo. Ranine is the first lady on the left, and Rima is the first lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to start selling cleaning materials to improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: 020306210004 Đại Long - Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture raising pigs. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.
Liên is 54 years old, and she is married with three children. Liên is the group leader of the 020306210004 Đại long - Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
In 2005, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital4
In the future, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en: Abdullahi is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi would have to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Abdullahi, similar to other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices during harvest.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business. Venancia has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from abaca weaving.

Venancia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Bonifrida

texts.en:
Bonifrida is 58 years old. She is married with seven children aged between six and 23 years; all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize for sale.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 57 years old and has four children. Vivencia is married and has one child who is still in school.

Vivencia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Vivencia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Vivencia has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

Vivencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed,  vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Mary has been working hard to manage her produce business in which sells produce like maize flour and beans. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour, rice, and millet flour for sale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and take good care of her children by providing them with enough food. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, rice and millet flour for sale,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase for more essential items

loans.name: Malam Shuaibu

texts.en:
Malam Shuaibu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Umar and Nuhu. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Malam Shuaibu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Malam Shuaibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Malam Shuaibu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 50-year-old married woman who earns a living through fishing. She lives with her family and five children in Concepcion, Iloilo. She helps her husband in their fishing business, which is their main source of income.
 
Arsenia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing items. A loan will enable Arsenia and her husband to improve their business, thus augmenting their income.

In the future, Arsenia wants to expand their fishing business in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others fishing items.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 56 years old and married with seven children. With one child still in school, Adelaida works very hard to provide for them all.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, beers, noodles, etc. to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, beers, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, beers, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 57 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Alma has asked for a 10,000 Philippines Pesos loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Muhammadu Nura

texts.en:
Muhammadu Nura is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Wasila, Fahat and Aliyu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Muhammadu Nura would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muhammadu Nura can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Muhammadu Nura spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idris would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Idris is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is engaged in fishing business with her husband. This is their main source of income for more than twenty years now.

Rema is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing equipment. A loan will help them improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Rema hopes to expand their fishing business in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Idiris

texts.en:
Idiris is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idiris would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idiris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Idiris is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing

loans.name: Mary Asabe

texts.en:
Mary Asabe is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mary Asabe joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her child: Dorcas.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Mary Asabe would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as school fees and uniforms. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mary Asabe can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mary Asabe  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her child, eventually hoping to ensure her child completes school and has a professional job.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms

loans.name: Areej Bwarej Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the featured borrower for Areej Bwarej Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and manage their lives at the same time.

Zainab is a 56-year-old married mother of five children who has worked in a grocery shop for eleven years, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Now, Zainab has asked for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new popular products to meet her customers' needs. 

Zainab is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Alifa is the lady sitting in the middle, and Fatima is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new popular products to meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer from Maimai village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Yahaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a maize farmer from Koda Gora village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ado would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ado can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ado, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en: Eugenie is the group leader, aged 38. She is married with four children aged between 10 and 19 years old, all of whom go to school. The group is called Duterimbere, which means “Vision” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change for a better future. She sells food stuffs and has been running a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and beans to sell.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 23-year-old married lady, who established her own retail business in 2009 to assist her husband in developing their living.

Amal's shop has diversified products. She sells gifts, gadgets, perfumes, special occasions needs, and stationery.

She is working hard to develop her business, especially during this period of the year. Thus for this reason, she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and New Year's gifts and gadgets to develop her business and increase her sales.

She hopes to expand and develop her business widely to respond to most of her customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and New Year's gifts and gadgets to develop her business and increase her sales.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of six children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their source of income.

Liezel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other things. This loan will help them improve their fishing business.

Liezel wants to expand their fishing venture in the future so that it will generate more revenue. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other things.

loans.name: Nhóm10 - Thôn 3 - Thọ Vực Group

texts.en:
Luyện has a retail business selling cake, milk, sugar, salt and other items. She is applying for a loan to purchase more cake, milk, sugar and salt to resell. Luyện has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Luyện is 37 years old and is married with two children. Luyện is the group leader of the Nhóm10 - Thôn 3 - Thọ Vực Group, which consists of four members. In 2013, Luyện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Luyện has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Luyện hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, milk, sugar and salt to resell.

loans.name: Nhóm 15 - Tây Sơn1 - Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Nghĩa is 51 years old and married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 15 - Tây Sơn1 - Phú Sơn 3 Solidarity Group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

Nghĩa has a service business providing housing rentals, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

This is Nghĩa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to maintain her housing rentals service.

With her business profit, Nghĩa hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to maintain her housing rentals service

loans.name: 031903070001.thị Trấn Quán Lào Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture raising pigs. She apply a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future. 
Hà is 39 years old, and she is married with two children. Hà lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in his business is the lack of capital. 


In 2013, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. Hà has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà is the group leader of the 031903070001.thị Trấn Quán Lào Group solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In the future, Hà hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 09 - Trần Phú - Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Huệ is 56 years old and is single with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 - Trần Phú - Phú Sơn3 Solidarity Group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

Huệ has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. and she is requesting a loan to purchase more products like this to resell. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

In 2012, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from them.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell

loans.name: Romie

texts.en:
Romie is a 46-year-old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has three children. He has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now.

Romie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. This loan will help him to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Romie hopes to expand his fishing business in order to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Bahtovar

texts.en:
Bahtovar was born in 1991. He is single and lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. 

Bahtovar is a student at the National University of Tajikistan. He studies well and reads many books. Bahtovbar wants to graduate university with success and to find a suitable job. Now, he needs your financial support because he must pay for his tuition fees. Bahtovar is asking for a loan to pay for his fees. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 37-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a business selling used clothes for about two years.  He buys a variety of clothes of womens and mens garments from the wholesale market and then sells to the people of his community. He earns enough through his business and needs more clothing collections to cater to more customers. 

For this reason, Nusrat requested the Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband. It helped him purchase more varieties of womens and mens garments for increasing sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of mens and womens garments for increasing sales.

loans.name: Amina A.

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years old, and lives in Bagamoyo district. She is married and has two children. Amina is a Camfed leaner guide, and teaches life skills to students in her nearby secondary school. She also operates a poultry business. 

Amina has requested a Kiva loan to expand her poultry business by building a store for keeping more chickens. She will use the profit from the loan to buy enough food for her chickens and household expenses for her family.

loans.use: to expand her poultry business by building a store for keeping more chickens.

loans.name: Mwajuma Saidi

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 29 years old and lives in the Bagamoyo District of Tanzania with her husband and two children. Mwajuma is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers her time to teach students life skills to boost their academic performance at her nearby secondary school. In addition to this, she has a pharmacy in her community. 

Mwajuma is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase different varieties of medicine to sell in her pharmacy. She plans to use her profits from the loan to offer her skills to a nearby college.

loans.use: to purchase different varieties of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Faudhia I.

texts.en:
Faudhia is 20 years old and lives in Bagamoyo District, Tanzania. Faudhia is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her nearby secondary school by teaching life skills to students in order to boost their aptitude for learning. 

Faudhia also has a business tailoring women’s clothing. She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a sewing machine and material for her business. She plans to use her profits to pay household expenses and increase her business materials.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and material for her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 23 years old and lives with her grandmother in Kibaha District, Tanzania. 

In her spare time, Rehema volunteers at a local secondary school and teaches students the value of education through life skills in order to boost their academic performance. In addition to this, Rehema has a video rental shop which also provides a phone charging service as well as sells phone covers to her customers. 

Rehema is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy more DVD and VCD movies for her shop to attract more customers. With the profits she will make, she intends to support her father and other two siblings in their daily house expenses.

loans.use: to buy more DVD and VCD movies for her shop to attract more customers.

loans.name: Mirelli Amarilis

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirelli,  tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres  hijos mayores de edad, el menor estudia en la universidad y es el que aun vive con ella. 
Doña Mirelli es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos y otros productos de catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres veces por semana unas tres horas por día pero también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, la mayor parte de su mercadería siempre es para entregar ya que los clientes cuando saben que va a viajar le encargan a su gusto. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, camisetas, blusas, pantalones y otras prendas que ella vende. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí capital known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the communal bank Grupo de Crédito Alfa meet every two weeks.  

This is where Mirelli, 41, lives.  She is a single mother of three adult children, the youngest of which studies at the university and still lives at home.

Mirelli is a woman who likes to work to cover her household expenses.  She is a merchant and sells clothing, shoes and other products by catalogue.  She works selling door-to-door, going out three times a week, three hours each day.  She also sells from home to well-known customers.  Most of her merchandise must be delivered because customers know when she is going to travel somewhere and they place orders for what they want.  Mirelli has been in this business for over ten years.

The loan will be used to buy sport shoes, t-shirts, blouses, pants and other clothing.  She has been a member of the bank grojup for ten years and likes the fact that she can finance her business with the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy sport shoes, t-shirts, blouses, pants and other clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a shop selling womens clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cinthia Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Cinthia, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de de 7 años el cual estudia en escuela.  Su esposo trabaja en una empresa estatal.
Doña Cinthia es  una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia, ella tiene a cargo el bar en una escuela de la localidad, allí  vende bocadillos y comidas nutritivos para los niños que asisten a esta institución, aguas, jugos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en horas de la mañana, en este negocio le ayuda una prima a quien le paga por sus servicios, ella lleva más de 5 años con este negocio  con el cual se gana algo por su cuenta. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí capital known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the communal bank Grupo de Crédito Alfa meet every two weeks.

This is where Cinthia, 26, lives.  She is married and has a 7-year-old son who attends school.  Her husband works for a state-owned company.

Cinthia is a very hard-wroking young woman who likes to earn her own income for the the family. She runs a snack bar at a school and sells sandwiches and healthy foods, as well as water, juices, etc. to the students there.  She works Monday through Friday in the mornings and has the help of her cousin who is paid for her services.  Cinthia has been in this business for five years.

This loan will be used to buy ingredients for the food she makes.  She has been a member of the bank group for two years and likes it because the loans are quick.  Her dream is to continue her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Hernán Arturo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive el señor Hernán, el tiene 22 años de edad y está casado.  Su esposa es comerciante, el lleva dos años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin muchos requisitos.
Don Hernán es joven muy trabajador que le gusta  ganarse lo suyo para el bien de su hogar, el tiene un deposito  de venta de agua en bidones en su casa, vende en su casa y también entrega a domicilio, el lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua en bidones y en todas las variedades. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí capital known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the communal bank Grupo de Crédito Alfa meet every two weeks.

This is where Hernán, 22, lives.  He is married and his wife is a merchant.  He has been in the bank group for two years and likes it because the loans are granted quickly and do not require much.

Hernán is a very hard-working young man who likes to earn his own income for the household.  He sells bottled water from his house and also makes deliveries.  He has been in business for three years and it has allowed him to get ahead.

He will use the loan to buy a variety of bottled waters.  His dream is to continue improving his business.

loans.use: To buy water.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como seguridad en la ciudad capital.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. Juan de 38 años de edad a tendido que luchar por la vida arriesgando su propia vida por los demás para poder tener un ingreso económico.

La actividad que el realiza es de seguridad en la capital, a el se le dio una oportunidad porque el llenaba todas las expectativas para optar a dicho empleo y a el dese hace un tiempo a querido realizar esta actividad, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante más de 8 años.

El uso respectivo que el dará al crédito es par la compra de terreno que le están ofreciendo en su comunidad donde el vive, oportunidad que Juan desea aprovechar para tener un terreno donde su familia pueda vivir en condiciones adecuadas. Uno de las aspiraciones de el es poder construir su casa propia para sus hijos para mejorar las condiciones de vida y sembrar cultivos en su terreno que quiere comprar.
texts.en:
Life gave him the opportunity to work in the capital city.  It was what he wanted, not only an open door but what lay behind it.  And what he found was what he wanted to become.  Juan is 38 years old and has had to struggle in life, putting his own life at risk, for others and to have an income.

He works in security in the capital and was given the opportunity because he had all the requirements for the job.  For some time he had wanted to work in this field and has been doing so for over eight years.

He will use the loan to buy land he is being offered in the community where he lives.  Juan wants to take advantage of the opportunity to have land where his family can live in adequate conditions.  One of his goals is to build his own house to improve his children's living conditions.  He also wants to grow crops on the land.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicines and pay for medical exams, transportation tickets and doctor's visit.

loans.name: Samanta Solange

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Samanta, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una  hija de 7 años  la cual estudia en escuela. Su esposo es contratista.
Doña Samanta es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para conseguir sus propios recursos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos L”eudine (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, cremas, perfumería y productos naturales). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en sus momentos libres a recorrer por donde están sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva tres años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cosméticos, cremas  y productos de belleza. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi department, and known for many years as the city of the tamarinds owing to the large quantity that once grew here, the members of the "Jesús de Nazaret" loan group meet every fortnight.

And it is here that 37-year-old Samanta lives: she is married and has one daughter, who is seven years old. Samanta's daughter is attending school, while her husband is a contractor. 

Samanta likes to take care of herself and earn her own income. She makes a living selling "L'Eudine" products (beauty products, cosmetics, creams, perfumes and natural products). She sells door-to-door, heading out to her customers' houses when she has free time. Samanta sells on credit, collecting payments every week or fortnight. Samanta has been doing this work for three years; with it, she is moving forward in life.

Samanta will use this loan to buy cosmetics, creams and other beauty products. Samanta has been with this loan group for three cycles and she likes it because of the help from loans. Samanta's dream is to give her daughter the best possible life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams and other beauty products.

loans.name: Deicy Candelaria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Deicy, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Deicy junto al esposo tienen un negocio de venta de comida, todos los días instalan un pequeño local en las afueras de una institución pública lugar por el cual pasan muchas personas que se sirven sus deliciosos platos, ellos solo venden desayunos y en ciertas días almuerzos, son muchos los clientes que día a día se sirven en su pequeño local el cual ya tienen por más de tres años, este negocio les permite salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años   y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi department, and known for many years as the city of the tamarinds owing to the large quantity that once grew here, the members of the "Jesús de Nazaret" loan group meet every fortnight.

And it is here that 35-year-old Deicy lives. She has a partner, and two children ages twelve and nine years old. Deicy's children are attending school while her husband is a businessman.

Together with her husband, Deicy has a business selling meals. Every day, the couple sets up a stall outside a public institution, where there are many passers-by, and serve their delicious dishes. The couple sells only breakfast, though on some days will also offer lunches. Deicy and her husband serve many customers every day in the stall that they have had for three years. This business allows the couple to move forward and their children what they need.

Deicy will use this loan to buy supplies for preparing dishes. Deicy has been with the loan group for two years and likes it because of the help that she receives from loans. Deicy's dream is to own a good restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sule Fulani

texts.en: Sule Fulani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sule Fulani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Iro and Sabo.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule Fulani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule Fulani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sule Fulani spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en: Safiya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Safiya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Lydia, Hannatu and Godiya. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Safiya would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safiya can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Safiya spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Petita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar Vive la señora Petita, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, dos de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja de conserje y en las noches de taxista.
Doña Petita al ver que a su esposo no le alcanza con lo que el gana decidió trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa  por catálogos y productos de Avon,  Yanbal, Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, ella también los fines de semana administra el bar en el lugar donde el esposo trabaja de conserje con lo cual le quedan mejores ganancias. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y varios víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds due to the large quantity of this fruit that was grown there in the past. This is the city where the members of the credit group "Jésus de Nazaret" meets every 15 days.

Señora Petita lives in this place. She is 54 years old and married, and she has six children from her marriage, all of whom are over the age of majority. Two of them still live with her. Petita's spouse works as a custodian, and also as a taxi driver by night.

Upon seeing that her spouse's income wasn't sufficient to meet their household needs, Doña Petita decided to work to help her family to get ahead. She works in commerce, selling clothes from catalogues and products from Avon, Yanbal and Belcorp (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She sells door-to-door, going out two to three times a week to offer her products. She sells them on credit and collects payment weekly. On weekends, Petita also works at the bar where her husband is a custodian, which also provides a better income to the family.

Petita will use this loan to purchase clothes, perfumes, creams and a variety of supplies to prepare food. She has been in this credit group since the start and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans. Her dreams are to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and various supplies

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Muhammad joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mathew, Samaila and Mercy.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Muhammad would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muhammad can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Muhammad spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Mangala Shg is a group consisting of 10 members, situated in a small village called Kandhara in Sambalpur District. Tarangini is the President of this group and she belongs to a very poor family. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For a long time, she has had a plan to open her own garment shop but after struggling a lot, she was not able to open it. So, she decided to take a loan to establish her shop. She will use her portion to buy a showcase and children's clothing to resell.

She hopes to make a house for her family and for her children to do well in their education. She plans to use her 50 percent of the profit for her children's education. She is grateful to Kiva and Kiva lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy a showcase and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar and his wife have been married for 10 years and have three children. Yashar's family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their home, which was in Fuzuli city and now they are living in the Baku region. Yashar's wife is a housewife and therefore, all needs of the family are provided by Yashar. He is a master who repairs gas and water systems. Over eight years he has been in this business and the quality of the work is good, therefore Yashar has a lot of customers. Today he wants to support his business, so Yashar has applied for a loan of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy construction materials, which are useful in his work. He says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all the lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to hire an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, increase business and, in the future, hire an assistant

loans.name: Saratu Ibrahim

texts.en: Saratu Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Samaila, Patience and Mercy.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu Ibrahim would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu Ibrahim can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Saratu Ibrahim spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is a 44-year-old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He has six children. Danny has been in the fishing business for more than three years now. He also runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling goods like food items and other things.

Danny is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and additional stock to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries. With a loan, Danny will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Danny wants to expand his business in order to generate income. He also wants to save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and additional stocks to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusuf joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Aimana, Paty and Ahmed.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusuf spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 50-year-old married mother of three children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her child's school transportation and stationary. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Ghada hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for for her child's school transportation and stationary

loans.name: Habila

texts.en: Habila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Habila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Anad, Abegail and Justina.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Habila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Habila spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
Santi, about 31 years old, lives in a small village named Rampur in Sambalpur District of Odisha, India. The only source of income for her family was a small grocery store. Having been hit by high inflation and an unbalanced monthly income, they could hardly think of saving anything for the future.

With an aim to increasin her income, she planned to expand her business. Santi tried to get a loan from several financial institutions, but she was unable to fulfill the requirements of banks and other institutions. 

She came to know about Peoples Forum and its services from a group member of another group from the same village. The only challenge for her was to motivate other villagers to form a group so that they can avail a loan. She managed to convince a few villagers to join the orientation meeting conducted by Peoples Forum. After understanding the benefits of the loan, another nine women stepped out to form a Self Help Group named Saraswati Shg.
 
All the members of this group were trained and educated about several small business models, which helped them to create a strong base for their future. They have requested this loan, which will help them to start the business. Santi will use her portion to buy sugar, edible oil, spices, cookies etc in bulk.

loans.use: to buy sugar, edible oil, spices, cookies etc in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Tutiyo

texts.en: Tutiyo comes from a rural area. She was born in 1956. Tutiyo is widowed and has three children. She has experienced a lot of difficulties. Her sons are rental workers. Tutiyo has 7 hectares of land where she grows different kinds of vegetables and crops. Tutiyo has additional income from animal husbandry. She works hard every day from early morning because she has a large family and needs money for providing her family with all the necessary things. Tutiyo has eight grandchildren and they are non-adults. Tutiyo is going to make new sowing but she has no money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their main source of living.

Eulogia needs a loan for her a business. She would like to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of a fishing boat. With a loan, she believes that they will be able to improve their catch, which will allow them to sell more fish to the market. 

In the future, Eulogia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of a fishing boat

loans.name: Luis Meliton

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive don Luis, tiene 63 años de edad, está divorciado y de esa relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad.
El señor Luis es un hombre que le ha tocado trabajar toda la vida para salir adelante, el es mecánico electricista y tiene un pequeño almacén en su casa en el cual se dedica a vender todo tipo de materiales eléctricos, fusibles, baterías de carros y muchos otros repuestos, a pesar de que su negocio es pequeño su clientela puede encontrar todo lo que necesitan razón por lo cual su clientela es muy buena, el lleva más de 40 años con este negocio el cual le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos y que estos hoy en día sean personas de bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar materiales electicos y baterías que le hacen mucha falta. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años   y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Jesus of Nazareth' Credit Group gather every other week in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds owing to the great quantity of this fruit that existed in past epochs.
This is where Luis lives. He is 63 years old and divorced, and from that former relationship he has three adult children.
Luis is someone who had to work his whole life to get by. He is an electrical repairman and has a small store at his house, in which he sells all types of electrical supplies: fuses, car batteries, and many other spare parts. Despite the small size of Luis's business, customers can find everything they need there and, for that reason, come to the shop in droves. Luis has had this business for more than 40 years, and it has enabled him to give his children a better life and make them the good people they are today.
This loan will be used to purchase electrical supplies and batteries, which are items crucial to Luis's trade. Luis has been a member of his credit group for two years and he appreciates the help offered by these loans. His dream is to keep prospering.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies and batteries.

loans.name: Letina

texts.en: Letina is 28 years old. She is a mother of three children. She is a Camfed learner guide volunteering in a secondary school helping youth understand life skills. Letina has a retail shop. She walks about 70 kilometres going to the city to purchase products for her shop. Letina uses her profit to pay school fees for her children. She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase her stock in bulk and sell wholesale in order to help her community members not to travel to the city to buy products. In that way, she will help her community and gain profit at the same time. Her dream is buy a van for transporting her products from the city to her village.

loans.use: to purchase her stock in bulk and sell at wholesale

loans.name: Leída Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito De Colorado que se reúne cada quince días en Colorado de el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Leída, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, una de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Leída es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en sus actividades, el tiene una volqueta en el cual se dedica a la venta de material pétreo y un tanquero en el cual entrega agua por la localidad y a empresas en la ciudad de Manta, el también les entrega el material pétreo a ciertas constructoras. Su esposo lleva dedicado a este negocio más de 17  años con el cual han sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar agua y material pétreo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque de esta forma ella le ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito De Colorado [the Colorado Lending Group] meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, known nationally and internationally. It is known for its famous paja toquilla (Panama) hats.

This is where Leída lives. She is 69 years old, married and has 4 grown children from this relationship. One of her children still lives with her. Her husband is a driver.    

Leída is a very good wife who is taking out the loan for her husband to use in his activities. He has a dump truck that he uses to sell stone material and a tanker with which he delivers water in the community and to businesses in the city of Manta. He also delivers stone material to certain construction companies. Her husband has been doing this activity for more than 17 years and with it they have gotten their family ahead. 

This loan is to buy water and stone material. She has been in the lending group since the beginning and she likes it because this way she helps her husband. Her dreams is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy water and stone material.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg Group

texts.en:
“The thing women have yet to learn is nobody gives you power. You just take it.”  What can be a better example than Maa Samaleswari SHG to prove this!!

With an aim to contribute to the family income, 10 women from a village joined hands to form a group. Rampur is a small village located in a remote area of Sambalpur district, Odisha, India. The strong determination of the group members led them to overcome the social barriers and they managed to convince their family members to form the group.
 
Jhili wants to use the loan to purchase agricultural equipment, seeds and fertilizers whereas other group members have planned to expand their businesses with this loan. Jhili is the president of this group. She is 25 years old and a mother of two children. Her husband works as a daily laborer. Jhili and her husband both decided to work together in their agricultural field to produce paddy and maize.
 
The members are trained on entrepreneurial skills by executives of Peoples Forum and they are committed to using the loan efficiently. The members have requested a loan of 150,000 INR to invest in their businesses, which will help them to build a strong base for a safe future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural equipment, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Chaurembo

texts.en: Chaurembo is 24 years old.  She lives with her parents in Kilolo District.  Chaurembo volunteers as a Camfed learner guide teaching student’s life skills and helping them to understand the quality of life. Chaurembo has a Mobile Money Transfer business. She uses her profit to buy household items to support her family. Chaurembo is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her capital and be able to serve more customers. Chaurembo plans to use the profit from the loan to employ one person to support help her at the shop.

loans.use: to increase her capital and be able to serve more customers

loans.name: Mwanaidi Saidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi,19, is not married. She is living with her parents at Bagamoyo district in Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide. By way of giving back to her community, Mwanaidi volunteers in her nearby secondary school encouraging learners to study hard and guiding them in life skills awareness. She engaged herself in selling women shoes. She requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by buying women's shoes in bulk and selling in her retail shop.  Mwanaidi believes a Kiva loan will change her life and she will use the profit to renovate her shop and employ one person to run the business and make a huge profit

loans.use: to expand her business by buying women shoes in bulk and selling in her retail shop

loans.name: Avenida 13 (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Avenida 13 se reúne cada 15 días en el centro de la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Emerita, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada   y de esta relación tienen una hija de 12  años la cual   estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Emerita es una muy buena madre y esposa que con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que generan el hogar y los estudios de su hija se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Avon  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan  sus clientes. Trabaja en horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora es más fresco y  también les encuentra a sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, tiene más de 8  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido a  salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es su primer ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y espera seguir por mucho tiempo recibiendo la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank “Avenida 13” meet fortnightly in downtown Manta. Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are constantly visited. It is a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions. This group of people decided to start a communal bank, which will be of great help for them. With the loans, they will be able to improve their small businesses. They all have different activities: commerce, food, and services, among other things.

One of the members is Emerita, who is 47 years old, married and has a 12-year-old daughter who goes to school. Her husband is a businessman. Emerita is a good mother and wife. She wanted to make her own money in order to help her husband with the home expenses and their daughter’s studies. She sells clothes, shoes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door, but also at home when her customers visit her. She works in the morning, when the weather is cool and her customers are easier to find. She sells on credit and collects the money every second week. She has been in this business for more than eight years, and this is how she helps her husband to get ahead.

With this loan, she will buy more clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. This is her first loan with this group and she hopes that she can continue to receive support through these loans for many years. Her dream is to give her daughter the best things.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wilzon

texts.es: Wilzon es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Arajllanga, en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus padres y solo tiene luz y agua El cliente es agricultor y quiere un prestamo para compra de ganado En su casa Wilzon es el unico que mantiene el hogar, sus padres estan delicados de salud Pero el cliente goza de buena salud por lo que espera su colaboracion para salir adelante
texts.en: Wilzon is single. He doesn't have any children and he lives with his parents in the community of Arajllanga in an adobe house that they own. It only has water and electricity. He wants a loan to buy cattle. In his house, Wilzon is the only one who supports the home. His parents have health problems but he is in good health. That is why he hopes for your cooperation to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto esta casado, tiene un hijo y vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus familiares El lugar no es comodo pero al menos la familia se las arregla para vivir decentemente Heriberto es chofer y quiere un credito para hacer mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues piensa que ya es necesario. Heriberto es la unica persona que gana ingresos en la casa por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Heriberto is married, has a son and lives in El Alto in an adobe house that belongs to family members. The place isn't comfortable but at least the family manages to live decently. Heriberto is a driver and he wants a loan to be able to do maintenance on his his means of transport, since he thinks it is necessary at this point.  Heriberto is the only person who earns an income in the house, so he needs its help.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his means of transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix a sewing machine.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy es una persona independiente que vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Fredyy se gana la vida elaborando palitos de pan y otros articulos de reposteria El cliente quiere un credito para comprar insumos como harina, azucar, sal, levadura, etc El problema de Freddy es que no tiene a quien acudir por eso necesita su ayuda, además, el cliente goza de buena salud
texts.en: Freddy is an independent person who lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house which is his property. Freddy earns a living making loaves of bread and other bakery items.
